Reviews.Title: “Value for $$$”
Reviews.Author: hmsg128
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, free wifi, decent breakfast, CCTVs overlooking the cars to ensure security. The folks manning the front desk were very friendly and helpful. Owner was also very helpful in recommending places to visit. Could not ask for more with the price we paid for. Will definitely stay over again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: Bunhun
Reviews.Content: TA reviews can nv be wrong! Booked a 2 nights stay at the Dolphin Motel and my stay throughout was pleasant! Felt safe sleeping at night knowing there will someone at the desk 24hrs with security cameras all around! The rooms are small but very clean! There're also free Wifi and the speed was fast! Wasnt expecting that since it was free! Do not hestitant to stay here when u are in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “San Diego On a Budget”
Reviews.Author: Skm64
Reviews.Content: Very Neat, Family operated Motel with all you need to have a vacation in San Diego, CA. One needs to rent a Car in San Diego any way for having an all inclusive vacation. Rooms are small but clean. Located closed to Marina, view is good and excellent seafood restaurant on a walking distance. Mitches Seafood was my favorite. Vey inexpensive. Morning coffee, Juice,fruit, yogurt and muffins available for breakfast. We had plumbing problem in our room which was propel fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn B
Reviews.Content: A freind and I recently went to San Diego just for a relaxing vacation and to visit friends in the area. I was looking for a clean, safe and affordable motel. The Dolphin Motel had very good reviews on this site so I booked my stay there and was not disappointed. The rooms were very clean, the location perfect and the staff very helpful. It is the perfect place if you are looking for a nice place to sleep after a day of site seeing. I would definitely book another stay there.

Reviews.Title: “small and friendly”
Reviews.Author: odonogeezer
Reviews.Content: booked and stayed two nights after reading trip adviser reviews and i can confirm yes rooms are small,bathrooms are small,but that is the only downside,good points super friendly people very clean rooms and a good location,free parking,remember this is a budget motel so no frills but just super value,yes we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome motel......even better staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: jowbaby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in November and couldn't have wished for a better base to our holiday. The welcome and check in was quick and easy and we were helped to our room with our bags. Room was immaculate and had everything's we needed. We asked to borrow the lap top hair dryer and mobile and nothing was a problem at all. Breakfast was brill....thank you hector for our apple and cherry pies every morning....perfect with the coffee and the read of the paper. The staff were really knowledgeable and really friendly, advising of places to go see, and paces to eat. On check out we were weighed and added to the book.....and said a goodbye, hopefully see you soon cash permitting. Awesome value for money, was like being looked after by family .....will return...thanks sooooo much.

Reviews.Title: “Great and so clean for the price!”
Reviews.Author: csu3102
Reviews.Content: This is what the big chain hotels should be doing! This place was no frills but clean. The owners (father and son) are "hands on" involved in making sure our needs were met. I would definitely return if you just need a comfortable place to stay while out all day.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a motel!”
Reviews.Author: livitup10
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here in early March. I had reviewed the motel via Trip Advisor and was fully aware of what to expect. Yes, the rooms are small but they are super clean and sufficient if all you need is to rest your tired body. You cannot beat this location and what they offer! Since we were out and about every day, we didn't partake of the breakfast but from the looks of it, it was pretty substantial (fruits, muffins, coffee)! The folks here are genuinely nice and offered us the use of a GPS if we needed one and also offered recommendations for meals. The area is safe to walk around in the evening as well. I would've given this location a higher rating however I couldn't, due to the fact that our noisy neighbors abruptly awoke us at an ungodly early hour. Keep in mind, that the walls are very thin. Other than that, everything was fine and we probably will return again on our next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: roadbum17
Reviews.Content: This is a great, independent motel. The owners and staff are incredibly helpful, making people feel welcome and going out of their way to help their guests, from restaurant recommendations to help with wifi problems (ours not theirs!) and tourist spots. The rooms are clean and bright with white sheets etc. The rooms aren't huge but are perfectly adequate and the location is lovely with some good places to eat nearby. The breakfast selection is good and it's buffet-style. If I were to go back to the lovely San Diego again, I'd definitely choose the Dolphin!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Therese K
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay. Friendly, helpful staff. Good continental breakfast in outdoor courtyard. Clean rooms. Has a very retro feel to it. Nice Point Loma / harbor location. Very easy to get to; safe location. Don't miss Sunset Cliffs! We loved it and would definitely stay again next time in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: small2006
Reviews.Content: We arrived tired and cold after a long 2 days at Disneyland and were so grateful to get into a comfy, warm, CLEAN room. The motel is in a great area, peaceful and safe and we woke up to a great view of the harbour the next morning. The free breakfast and wifi are huge bonuses (blueberry muffins - lovely!!) not to mention free parking. The owners obviously care so much about their property and their guests and every morning of our 3 day stay Alan brought us a map of somewhere new to visit. This place is such great value and the city of San Diego is beautiful. If you choose not to stay here then you'll be doing yourself a disservice. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “old fashioned value”
Reviews.Author: 80hours
Reviews.Content: This place is like a throw back to the way motels look in old movies. We stayed here two nights. Very friendly helpful staff. They gave great recommendations for things to see outside of the usual. Nice location. Right across the street from the pier. We went for an early morning walk & saw fisherman bringing in the Yellow Tuna! They would even loan you a GPS if you needed one to get around. Yes the rooms are tiny & sparse. But the service is beyond all the big places. It is immaculately clean, has free internet, free parking, plus, a light breakfast is included. Coffee, juice, yogurt & fruit.

Reviews.Title: “The best deal we've ever found!”
Reviews.Author: Emily N
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to San Diego to celebrate our three year wedding anniversary. As graduate students, we are on a tight budget. We chose the Dolphin Motel because we had heard it was a nice place to stay with great prices. We were really impressed! The owners and staff we incredibly friendly and helpful. Definitely top-notch service! The room was small but very clean and the motel is in walking distance of the harbor and some wonderful restaurants. If you need anything (a cab, a restaurant suggestion, etc.) just ask at the front desk. They helped us out a lot!

Reviews.Title: “The beds were the most comfortable ever and the area felt extremely safe.”
Reviews.Author: havilon
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this motel for comfort, location, and safety!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, family owned and operated motel.”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn A
Reviews.Content: Drove to the Dolphin from the San Diego Airport in 10 minutes! We arrived later in the evening and were happy to have our keys handed to us almost as we walked in. The rooms are small, but VERY CLEAN. Great linens. Breakfast is served in the small courtyard and consists of muffins, yogurt, juice, bananas, and coffee. Just right! The staff and owners make you feel at home and are extremely helpful. Will definately come back. Best budget motel we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff, basic rooms, not the best location”
Reviews.Author: MikeR1989
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in the Dolphin Motel and we can say that it's reasonably priced for the offered accommodation. The staff was very friendly and courteous, they always tried to support us in what we planned to do in San Diego (e.g. they gave us a Seaworld coupon which saved us 20$ of the entrance fee per person!). The room was pretty small, but very clean. Anyhow the size is big enough for a city trip where you don't spend very much time in the motel. The offered breakfast was good and there was quite some kind of variety (orange juice, yoghurt, cereals, fruits, coffee, tea, .... AND delicious muffins). Contrary to the owners statement on the website, the planes which are landing on/starting from the near San Diego International Airport are clearly audible. One thing which was very annoying was the fact that people were gathering in front of our room around 6am. They smoked, tattled and were noisy. This happened due to the fact that there was a table with chairs and ash-trays located right next to our room. In our opinion these things should be removed. The location is definitely too quiet and boring for young people. For our next visit to San Diego we would consider to pay a little bit more to get a hotel Downtown near Gaslamp Quarter, which is definitely a better location for young guys.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HomelyP
Reviews.Content: The staff and owners were friendly, helpful and greatly interested your experience. The complimentary breakfast is outdoors so we took it to our room as it was cold that day. It consisted of muffins, yogurt, bananas, apples and the usual beverages. The room is very small and basic, but the bed was very comfortable. Although the rooms have no phones there is a complimentary cell for local calls.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Divorce Recovery!”
Reviews.Author: COmujer
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the Dolphin Motel shortly after my "release" from an abusive marriage in 2008. I wanted to reclaim San Diego, a place I've loved and visited for years. I drove the eight hours from Tucson for a short three-day weekend and was warmly welcomed by the staff. Felt safe and secure in my little upstairs room with the all-white linens. That first night I walked across the street to a little harbor restaurant for some fish'n-chips, and later fell blissfully asleep between crisp white sheets. I can't tell you how special that weekend was in my old stomping ground in Point Loma. Took the usual drive out to Cabrillo Monument. Anyway...I am thrilled to be returning again in April 2012. The rooms are simple, clean and cozy. Love the little continental breakfast in the morning. This is a great motel for women traveling alone or for anyone who wants clean, inexpensive, and nostalgic retreat in authentic old San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “best budget hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: profegringo
Reviews.Content: Simple accommodations: small rooms, basic amenities, but everything spotless and service above and beyond what you expect anywhere. I arrived and within five minutes the gentleman at the reception had made change for my taxi driver, ordered me an airport taxi for the following morning and printed my boarding pass! Rooms are minimal, but comfortable with TV and free wifi, and a nice breakfast, including fresh fruit, yogurt, coffee, Trader Joe's juice, muffins. I've had much less pleasant experiences in chain hotels for much more than the $60 I paid here. Another plus: hotel is just a few minutes away from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “For a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: D B
Reviews.Content: This is the best budget motel/hotel I ever stayed in. If you are the like me and really use your room to sleep and shower then this is the place for you. Helpful staff that is always willing to make your stay more fun. This place is a bit of a throw back to the 1960's motels, but with FREE parking and right next to the bay, I mean right across the street, plus other freebies thrown in (GPS loaner, laptop use, baggage scale, boarding passes printed) and real down home owners and staff, you can't go wrong. But, if you need a fancy fountain in the lobby and uniformed staff then go down the street. This place was very clean and free morning coffee and goodies to boot. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “On the list of "must return to" motels!”
Reviews.Author: Emma-Leigh L
Reviews.Content: The day after I ran the Tinker Bell Half Marathon in Disneyland, my husband and I headed to San Diego for two days of rest and relaxation. Having grown up along the Southern New Jersey Shore, I immediately fell in love with the familiar, quaint look and feel of the Dolphin Motel. It is a wonderful blend of the old and the new that just works well for travelers looking for clean, simple accomodations in a beautiful harbour view setting. The room was small, but immaculate and the view from our second floor was breath taking. There is no fear of kicking off your shoes and walking on the floors at this establishment! The bed was comfortable and the television was a new flat screen model. There is a modest continental breakfast served outside with delicious coffee, juice, muffins, fruit and yogurt. During our stay we interacted with two different staff members as well as the owner of the motel. All were pleasant and willing to do whatever was necessary to make our stay enjoyable. My only regret is that we were only able to stay one night. As residents of Colorado now, Southern California, has become a favorite vacation destination for us. Future trips are sure to include a stop over at the Dolphin Motel!

Reviews.Title: “The best motel I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: sfergus1979
Reviews.Content: Free Wifi and free breakfast plus the 1st class service make this the best motel I've ever stayed in. Rooms were clean and of reasonable size. Very close to airport and perfectly situated between downtown and the beaches. Reception printed off our boarding passes and even let us borrow a lap top for no extra charge. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Over the Top!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy M
Reviews.Content: The Dolphin Motel is a great place for the right person. It's economical, clean, directly across from the harbor (we watched the fishing boats come in, which was great fun!), situated near some very nice restaurants you can walk to, and has terrific employees. The owner is on site every day, and over breakfast (served from 6:00 on for early risers) people visit, meet, chat, and share stories. It's not for everyone; the rooms are small, have no phone, and some amenities have to be requested. (Want an iron and ironing board? No problem.) The breakfast is nice and the coffee is good. We met a number of other couples who were very much like us: in our 60's, adventurous and watching our pennies, out to see San Diego from the ground up. We also saw families and groups who had planned agendas. But that's not the best part... On our third day in San Diego, our rental car was broken into and we lost MANY valuable items, including our cell phone and GPS system. The Dolphin folks were extremely kind, and promptly provided us with a GPS AND a cell phone, which we could use as much as we needed. No charge. It was very helpful to have both, and we used the phone to contact our insurance agent, the police, etc. Dolphin people could not have been kinder. My husband and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who isn't fussy about "fancy" and cares about "kindness."

Reviews.Title: “We'd do it again and again”
Reviews.Author: paul o
Reviews.Content: We found this quant little place by chance while spending a day in town on our honeymoon, after a great cruise, two years ago. Since then have been back for our two anniversaries as well as our birthday (twice)(we have the same birthdate- go figure). Everyone who works there is super friendly and willing to assist you in anything short of taking the adventure for you (although I am sure they wish they could). There isn't much room for parties, but then who needs it when you have San Diego as the backdrop. The continental breakfast is great only to be outdone by the terrific view of the bay and morining sunrises.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive is not the same as cheap.”
Reviews.Author: Landworld
Reviews.Content: First. Service. Old fashioned, polite, one on one, not trying to sell you something service. Genuine people work here and they LIKE what they do! They LIKE what they do. Said it twice and it is not enough. The rooms are small. They are clean (you can walk around without socks on). They are a place to sleep and shower. The Dolphin is still a lot more than that. Great little breakfast. Super friendly folks. Owners are hands on. And it extends to the guests. Everybody there is a little friendlier because of this place. Delightful. We stayed four nights and it got a lttle cramped. But truth is, so would the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great service makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: Taylorstravel
Reviews.Content: We got just what we had hoped for and a bit more at the dolphin. It is great to see the kind of service you can get when the people who work there genuinely care about their guests and their business. I was pleased that the street was quiet at night and it was in an area where we always felt safe. Location to access the zoo, seaworld, etc was also a bonus. Five star service at a budget price! Thanks to all the staff who made our stay so great. Our kids were sad to leave the Dolphin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Motel with 5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: yeoyeoyeo
Reviews.Content: First off I want to make clear, this is a Basic, affordable Motel. With that said I want to rave about my Stay! I found this Motel off of Trip Advisor and all the great reviews. They are not wrong and this is why- My Dad, Son and I reserved two rooms. They were clean beyond belief. They have a wonderful little patio set up for breakfast in the mornings. The Family that owns the place actually work it. The Father shows up in the morning, giving out hot apple pie and visiting with guests While the continental breakfast is being done. The son is there as well and extremely helpful with tips about the area. On one of our days we wanted to go to an IN & OUT BURGER due to my son wanted to try it and the staff Thomas found one for us and gave us a GPS to use. On our day before we were to leave another great staff member did our boarding passes while we were at the San Diego Zoo. I would love to do a shout out to Steve and Thomas. We were in town to do the Midway Museum and this little motel made my Dad feel at home. It is in a great location surrounded by much higher price property's but I can assure you, this will be your place of choice in Point Loma from your first stay on......

Reviews.Title: “What a great deal!”
Reviews.Author: buttonwoodbrook
Reviews.Content: As previous reviewers have stated this is an unbelievable deal in San Diego. It is right across from the sport fishing pier which is a fun place to stroll through. Many beautiful, expensive sail boats. It is not fancy but clean and well kept. All the staff, including the owner are friendly and very helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: ziggz43
Reviews.Content: Read great reviews about this place, thought we would give it a try for New Years Eve. Checked in early, about 12:30 in the afternoon on a saturday. Asked where a good place to watch the Laker game was, and front desk gave us a free appetizer coupon for mexican spot down the block. Went into room to get ready, was not wowwed by any means. But it was clean, nice flatscreen, big bed, clean restroom. Great parking, quiet and the free breakfast was good. Great service, all around good experience. If you are used to Ritz Carlton glitter and glam this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent inexpensive stay”
Reviews.Author: R.RoseManhattanBeach
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay for a few nights, before leaving on a long range fishing trip from Point Loma. My expectations were low because of the cheap price. However, the service was better then most 4-5 star hotels. One night when we had trouble getting a taxi, the front desk person went out to the sidewalk with a flashlight to help flag down our ride. This was after he made many calls on our behalf.(due to a busy Holiday night) He wouldn't even accept a tip. The room ws clean and the continental breakfast was also good. I will always return to the Dolphin when needing a room in the Point Loma area.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough!”
Reviews.Author: VinoRossoNorthWest
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with my daughters last week. Safe, Clean...amazing location (you will need a rental car...but you can park it here for free), comfortable, quiet - security monitored. Friendly staff...go out of their way to be helpful and attentive. Owner is a gem. Continental breakfast is ample and real food. All this and very very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Vecchio7
Reviews.Content: A quaint little motel in an excellent area. I was looking for a place where my little family could rest our heads after a day at Sea World. We have small children and we were only going for a couple hours a day, but I didn't want to spend a lot of money. I read some reviews of other similar priced motels in the area and I read some alarming stuff. Then I came across this motel. I called and booked a room immediately. They knew my name when I checked in. The room was super clean with a brand new mattress (I was later told by the nice owner). It is a tiny room, but they pack a lot of awesome stuff other motels do not, like flat screen televisions, refrigerators, awesome air conditioner, brand new carpet and a queen and twin bed. We loved the retro feel of the room itself. The best thing was this place was more than $30 cheaper than any other motel in the area. It was also really close to a lot of food establishments and grocery stores. We like the local chain MXN. Yummy Mexican food. Oh and I am using their free internet to post this review right now.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem!”
Reviews.Author: Oztwinkletoes
Reviews.Content: Found this little gem of accommodation through Trip Advisor, we were visiting San Diego for 2 days and was looking for something inexpensive with parking. The Dolphin Motel was a great option, while out of the CBD and on the other side of the airport, it's only a 10-15 minute drive to Gaslamp Quarter so that suited us fine. The accommodation is basic and very clean, all of the staff are very friendly and extremely helpful and breakfast in the courtyard is an added bonus! If you are looking for 5-star accommodation this may not be the place for you but if you are wanting somewhere that is value for money, clean and with great service than stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “A Five Star Experience....”
Reviews.Author: CallinItLikeItIs
Reviews.Content: Small, clean rooms. Friendly staff. Exactly what they promise. It's inexpensive, comfortable, and friendly. Proprietor goes the distance to keep this older motel upgraded (flat screen TV, very comfortable beds, and immaculately clean) Property is monitored for security. (Bright lights outside were problematic inside: Maybe better curtains?) Continental breakfast in the morning was pleasant. Well located: Walking distance to great places to eat and stroll. (4-star rating only because it is a old motel and "overall rating of this property" would have to include this in the equation.) Owner and staff made us feel like family and had genuine concern for our comfort and good time.

Reviews.Title: “Super value, great, friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: alibabnet
Reviews.Content: Staff is super friendly. Rooms are pretty nice, super clean. LCD TV, large nice bed, good comfort for a super price! Why stay elsewhere when you re on a short stay in SD? Only inconvenient is that you hear the noise of the street sometimes. But really not a big deal to me.

Reviews.Title: “As advertised”
Reviews.Author: GEF05
Reviews.Content: Small, clean rooms. Friendly staff. Cheap rates. Exactly what they promise. Yes, you can hear some traffic noise. Yes, you can hear tv from the next room. But it's cheap, comfortable, and friendly. Good shower. Decent coffee and muffins in the morning. Well located. Nice walk-in closets.

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable service”
Reviews.Author: ReluctantTraveler00
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in the beginning of December. We had three rooms total, with extended family that met up with us for a visit. The proprietor and staff are just amazing, I haven't experienced customer service like this ever. From the front desk to the housekeeping staff everyone was friendly and helpful - went out of their way to be accomodating and think of things we might need even before we asked. Two examples; the housekeeper brought extra blankets to our rooms one evening because the temps were expected to be low that night, and one morning the guy from the front desk came running out of the office with 4 bottles of water for our group as we were loading in the car to head out for a day trip, just because he thought we might need it. The rooms are small, bathrooms are small and the furnishing is very basic. Pillows are not soft, so bring your own if thats important to you. The rooms are clean and functional, have free wireless internet and cable tv. No telephone, microwave or coffee pot in rooms. They will provide a hairdryer, telephone or gps on request and will print boarding passes and weigh luggage at the front desk. We stayed both upstairs and downstairs as we switched rooms to have a harbor view when one became available - there were alot of raves about the view but I didn't find it that great, nice but not necessary. They do provide a continental breakfast which was average fare. There are coffee shops, restaurants, bookshop, pharmacy, and little gift shops all within walking distance. All in all this is a fantastic place; clean, safe, central location, great service and price.

Reviews.Title: “2nd building unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: SFGuy35
Reviews.Content: I'm all for quirky budget hotels, and like to support standalone businesses. I stayed at the Dolphin on an unseasonably rainy Sunday a few weeks ago, and it was clean, the proprietor was pleasant, and the price was low. But there are a few things potential customers should know. The property consists of two buildings, a main building containing the small check-in office, with rooms whose doors face the harbor, next to the pool and outdoor area, and a second building, which I was shuttled off to. This is basically a sort of shack in the middle of the parking lot, an extremely awkward spot that feels uncomfortably exposed. My tiny room, with its windows facing the stairs and directly over the cars, felt like one of those art projects where a performer lives inside a glass cage on a street. I'm not sure I believe in "feng shui" but I felt a sick anxiety the entire time I was in the room. The door seemed like it was made of cardboard and blocked sound about as well as a sheet, adding to the sense of exposure. And the bed was as hard as a rock. For $50 plus tax I'm not expecting mints on the pillow, and yes, the place was pretty spotless, with bright white decor and a new (if small) flat screen TV. But it was such an uncomfortable spot that I barely slept, and longed for the standardized comforts of the myriad chain hotels nearby--Ramadas, Comforts, etc. The feeling that you're in a building that won't blow over in a breeze is worth an extra $25, I think. Live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “Such a nice surprise...”
Reviews.Author: patticheek
Reviews.Content: We so enjoyed our stay at the Dolphin Motel near Shelter Island, SanDiego! We have been visiting SD for over 4 years and have stayed in many hotels from Oceanside to Sanysidro, from o the bigger chains to the little trendy ones down in the Gaslamp district, to the highrises by the harbor, and we have to say that The Dolphin was just perfect for our needs. We love traveling around the area and so most of the time we spend in a hotel is to sleep and take a shower, well we had just what we needed and it was clean, efficient and just right. The folks there are so nice and very helpful. We arrived in SD around 9 AM and our room was all ready for us to take a nap after traveling all night. That in itself was a very pleasant surprise. And that it is located right in the middle of all of the boat action, yacht clubs, we were delighted. We decided to use public transit, so the bus stop was right there, and it was easy to connect with the trolley as well. We have rented cars before while visiting, but because it was so easy to get around using transit, we loved staying there at the Dolphin. We weren't at all disturbed by noise from the street, but if you have a problem with that, just use ear plugs, but truthfully the white noise from the air unit took care of that. The rooms are small, but adequate and the shower is great, no shortage on anything. Wifi, anything that you may need, and breakfast outside in the courtyard. Everyone was so nice, not a grumpy one in the bunch. Where have you been all our lives , Dolphin, we will be staying there again probably next summer. Do not hesitate to stay at the Dolphin, of course if you would rather spend a lot of money go elsewhere. We love the Dolphin and hope all reads this as a total 100% recommendation.I do think that this is one for quieter people, they don't allow loud parties so be mindful of that.There are places in the area for partying, just call a cab to get home. Or do like us and walk. One highlight for us was the trip to Pt Loma lighthouse, just walk down the street and catch the bus, it is a beautiful place. Thanks Dolphin!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, friendly good price”
Reviews.Author: zwriter
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week. The location is great to get to the airport and many different sites that San Diego offers. The staff including the owners were friendly and helpful. Everyday we got clean towels and the maid without asking us changed our sheets twice! The room is small and it sits on the corner of a quiet street and a main street- at times it was noisy at night. The walls are thin and two nights we had people next to us that listened to TV till the wee hours of the morning. Finally, I convinced my husband to wear earplugs like I do. The bed, pillows and blankets were comfortable. Overall, great location and reasonable rates!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Room and Location, Excellent Personnel”
Reviews.Author: RTD1954
Reviews.Content: Selected this motel because of the rating of being #7 in San Diego and price was reasonable ($60-$70). I'm not a fancy room person, usually keep things cheap 2-3 star so my level of need is reasonable. The room was smallish and old, but very clean as everyone says. There was no shampoo and no phone in the room (though one was available in the office) and a hole in the screen that let some termites in onto the bathroom windowsill. Parking was crowded and on the opposite side of the building from the room entrances. There were other places that were similarly priced closer to the cruise port,downtown and the other sights. (we had a car, so not a big deal, but still added 5-10 minutes to our drive each time. If you were going sport fishing, it is perfectly located. Walking distance to many marina locations. As mentioned in other reviews, the staff was absolutely excellent. Very accommodating, friendly, cleaning staff and front desk. GPS available for free (if not already taken out), local phone calling on their cell, printer for online boading passes, wi-fi for free and nice TV with lots of channels. Breakfast was pretty good. Open air, so when it rained (as it did for us), the microwave is not available (covered and unplugged), but great on a normal San Diego morning. Fresh apple/berry pies from McDonalds on most mornings, OJ, yogurt, coffee, muffins. Good continental breakfast served till a leisurely 10:30 am which was great. I hate those places that start at 6am and shut down by 9am. So, the room was the disappointment but the staff was excellent. I think there are better places to stay in the same price point that would be closer and a bit roomier and updated. I will be looking for other places to stay, even for a few extra dollars, next time I visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Ben995
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in Dolphin motel. Staff and owners were friendly and very helpful. Location is also great. Highly reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: AnasRockworld
Reviews.Content: This is the kind of Motel you see is the movies, true story! The staff is amazing! they help with anything you need and they are quite friendly as well. The place is very basic but super clean! The offer a few things for breakfast (bananas, coffee, etc). You will be close from public transportation + it's 5 minutes from the airport! Great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and an excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Peteg1013
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights an was very pleased. The room was a little small and a bit spartan but the location is wonderful. It is a short walk from many restaurants and the marina.And for $55 it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Old-school and proud of it!”
Reviews.Author: MMPera
Reviews.Content: Clean, clean, clean! Everything is white - the bed linens, the towels, the walls, as well as the outside stairs and railings, which the spunky 80-year-old owner touches up regularly with a can of white paint. And if you want to know anything about Point Loma, he was formerly the number one real estate agent in the area and knows the place like the back of his hand. The rooms are modest and the heater/air conditioning unit a bit noisy, but the location, price, and friendly staff all make up for it. An old-school kind of place that's hard to find anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Friendly, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Harmofwill76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dolphin for a total of 3 nights over our 6 night trip to Southern CA. The rooms are immaculately clean and the staff is wonderful. Breakfast in the mornings got our day off to a great start (muffins, coffee, OJ, yogurt, bananas) and the location is fantastic. Not far from the airport and close to the freeways. Everyone we interacted with, from front desk to night staff to the friendly lady (I think named Lynn?) who cleaned our rooms, was terrific. Highly recommended for safe, clean, affordable accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect deal for a short stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Hernan S
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking in a short stay in San Diego, Dolphin Motel is your place. Very clean room, relaxing enviroment, well located and most important, the owners and staff were extremely kind, always with a smile on their faces. I really recommend this place...

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back - soon, I hope”
Reviews.Author: B.Lanc
Reviews.Content: The location, staff and room were all great. The staff suggested several local restaurants (most within walking distance) and we were glad for their recommendations. They also suggested places to go sight seeing, and since this was our first time to San Diego we appreciated their input. They also gave us maps and directions, and an umbrella on the one day it rained. The free breakfast is not fancy, but had several options including bananas, yogurt, muffins, coffee, tea. The rooms are small, but include flat screen TV, refrigerators, a nice clean shower, and nice, comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “It was great to be back!”
Reviews.Author: audreymahoney
Reviews.Content: I couldn't find where to write the new review so I ended up reading all the previous ones to get here! Once again, everyone said what I'd like to say, but better! My daughter and I also were there the nite of the power outage - the owners and staff took care of absolutely everything possible that couldbe done for the "occasion" - no inconvenience; in fact, it was sort of restful! I can't believe the overall atmosphere they maintain consistently - with all the people they meet year in and year out (many, many return as did we), they greeted us as old friends. We hope to make it back again next year - it's becoming a "mecca" for us. Thank you each and every one at the Dolphin. Audrey Mahoney

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: Emma Y
Reviews.Content: Staff went above and beyond normal customer care. Helping with advice on where to eat and places to visit. We forgot suntan lotion and they gave us some to save us going to a shop. The location of the motel is excellent, being 15mins from airport. 20 mins from Seaworld and 25mins to Balboa Park. It is central to all tourist sites. The room was lovely, clean and quiet, wIth our room having a view over the harbour. Would and will definitely being staying here again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: MWalsh82
Reviews.Content: I was doubious about staying at the Dolphin. The main thing that changed my mind was not just that it is one of the most affordable motels in San Diego, but that it's proprietor takes the time to read all these reviews and actually responds to many of them. That is the mark of someone who truely cares about his business. My husband and I stayed at the Dolphin for 5 days towards the end of October. Although the weather was disappointing the Dolphin was not. The building itself is an older building but it is very well maintained. Yes, the rooms are small, but the bed is very comfortable and the room was very clean and everything in it worked great - especially the shower (great water pressure!). A continental style breakfast was provided every morning in the courtyard - coffee, juice, bananas, yogurt, muffins, McDonalds apple pies,etc. We never had a problem finding parking. The staff was very friendly and attentive to our needs. Even before we arrived for our stay, we were notified that the motel and surrounding area would be out of power the night we were to arrive. Jess provided us with a flashlight when we arrived. It is so rare to find people who actually enjoy thier job. Well, it was obvious that these folks do. I think the friendly and relaxed atmosphere that the staff creates, causes thier patrons to be more friendly as well. Whenever, we'd pass through the courtyard, other patrons would say hello or good morning. You're lucky if other people even look at you in public these days! My only advice to future patrons would be to be ready for thin walls. The folks next to us were not especially loud, but we could hear them talking pretty clearly through the walls. We turned the AC/Heat unit in the room on "fan" and that helped alot. So, if you are a light sleeper bring earplugs or turn on that fan. Otherwise, the other patrons were very respectful of the "9pm-9am quiet time." Thank you to the Dolphin for running such an affordable and pleasant establishment! We'll definitely stay here again if we ever travel to SD again. ~M. Walsh

Reviews.Title: “A Great Motel!”
Reviews.Author: Mikeandkaren1
Reviews.Content: This is an incredibly friendly and welcoming family run motel in a great location. The staff were very attentive and went out of their way to be helpful. We would have no qualms about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: spectre521
Reviews.Content: By now you have read all the reviews and the only thing I can say is "I'll be Back". Yes its older, not as pretty as most other hotels in the area, that start at twice the price. I Stayed 3 enjoyable days at this hotel and spent several hours on the deck, meeting and conversing with my next door neighbors in the evenings. Its very clean. If you "need" a large suite then this is not your hotel. If you want to a room to sleep and not spend $$$, this is it. Also the staff was always present and extremely helpful. Thanks Tom.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect one-night stay”
Reviews.Author: Bellablue80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on 10/25/11 and what could have been a very stressful stay in San Diego ended up being very smooth. Personal business took me from Texas to San Diego and before I knew it I was booking a flight out to CA with a one-day notice. A friend suggested I stay at the Dolphin Motel since I would only be in town for one night and most of that time I would be out taking care of business. I called up the motel less than 24 hours before arrival and Thomas was very helpful with my booking. My flight arrived at 7am into LAX and after getting a rental and driving down I anticipated arriving to SD around 11. I has asked Thomas if I could check in two hours early and we compromised and I checked in at 12pm. The motel itself is very clean and efficient. Although an older building, the management obviously works hard to maintain the building. There is plenty of parking and lots of shops and restaurants around. I was given a room in the building attached to the front desk; it contained a couple of dressers, a good sized fridge, comfy queen-sized bed and a pretty nice tv (it's much nicer than the one I have at home). The bathroom is in step with the age of the building but clean and with plenty of towels. Frankly the walls were a little thin and I felt at times that I might have been making too much noise, but I never got a complaint from the management. The following day I had a very important appointment downtown and it started running long. I rang up the front desk and explained my situation. The motel was very gracious and allowed me a late check out without any fuss. This may well be an exception and not the rule but I was so grateful when they said I had more time. I agree with others that say this is not a luxury hotel, but they don't bill themselves as such. It is a good, honest, clean, serviceable motel and I highly recommend it because service of this caliber is becoming very hard to find. (PS: Thomas also fixed the internet in my room and even brought me some bottled water for my trouble.)

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential Roadside Motel”
Reviews.Author: RossFarquhar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dolphin Motel for a couple of nights as part of a roadtrip through California, which it's perfect for. Luxurious it is not, but for this price and purpose you're primarily looking for security and cleanliness and the Dolphin delivers on both of these 100%. What sets it apart, though, are the people who run it. Incredibly friendly, clearly a family run business who depend on their reputation and so consistently deliver a great experience (see the other reviews on here). Against a raft of chain motels, I'd choose the Dolphin every time for this reason alone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent motel”
Reviews.Author: Michael T
Reviews.Content: One block off Harbor Drive across from the waterfront on Shelter Island. A couple of miles from the airport with easy access to the downtown. Delightful setting with many good restaurants from one to four blocks away. The motel is basic, but if you don't demand luxury, is extremely nice. Clean white bedspreads, new carpet, plenty of fluffy new towels, flat screen TVs, fast wi-fi. The management and staff are very helpful and always available. They offer services I've never seen in a hotel of any price range such as loaner GPS's, cell phones, and lap tops. Nice Continental breakfast with fruit, yogurt, pastries, coffee, and tea. And the price is very right. I paid $55 a night for myself in a room with a very comfortable double bed. This will be my lodging whenever I return to San Diego. M.Thompson - Asheville, NC

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Colin M
Reviews.Content: A small, old-fashioned, family run motel, but super clean, comfortable and affordable. What sets them apart is their outstanding service. The staff went out of their way to help me with other stuff: bike rental, suggested bike routes, restaurant suggestions, taxi reservations, boarding pass print-out, etc. It was like having a concierge in a fancy hotel. I have stayed there twice and I will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: yairm
Reviews.Content: A basic motel close to the airport & port, but has a very welcoming atmosphere and you get the feeling you ARE welcome. Small room, with a fridge and folding table, and a new LCD TV. There's really no need for anything else. Small free breakfast, good wifi service and a scale that can help before heading to the airport... All in all, it was a very good experience and I'll most definately return when I come to SD again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and basic, good value”
Reviews.Author: amester57
Reviews.Content: Trying to find a cheap, clean hotel near the San Diego airport for one night on July 4th weekend proved to be quite challenging. Luckily, my husband and I found the Dolphin Motel. This is a no-frills motel but it was everything that we needed for the night before our early flight back to NYC. The room was VERY clean, which is obviously the most important thing! The man staffing the front desk (for the entire 12 hours we were there) was super friendly and helpful - he gave us a great restaurant recommendation, saved a hair dryer for me, and even reminded us to grab a muffin and coffee before we checked out. I would recommend this independently-owned and operated motel to anyone looking for a comfortable, clean, cheap place to crash in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Road Trip part 2”
Reviews.Author: akoobra
Reviews.Content: Great little motel in the perfect location. Small room but there is so much to do that it is not an issue. The rooms are clean and basic. For the price this is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Felt just like home, convenient and great location”
Reviews.Author: Chao Y
Reviews.Content: Over last weekend was attending a seminar at the nearby Sheraton. Guess what? For the price of one nite at Sheraton, I was lucky to get two nites at Dolphin. It was only 5 minutes drive so I was very happy to save a bundle. Love the non-smoking room. The place is quaint, cozy and clean. Best of all the staff are so friendly and they really showed through their actions. The second nite was late in getting in and luckily there was still one spot left. If the staff didnt show me I would not have seen that parking space. If I ever take another trip to San Diego, guess what - I will book myself at Dolphin's.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, good location, friendly....”
Reviews.Author: matthew f
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights whilst visiting some friends in San Diego. We based the stay on the good reviews and were not disappointed, the staff were unbelievably friendly, whether it was 7am or 1am. Rooms were clean and adequate, not somewhere you want to spend all day but comfortable enough to spend the night. Amenities are great for this price, we didnt take advantage of anything other than the free breakfast (McDs apple pies, bananas and muffins) but they offered gps and cell phone loan, maps, internet and more. There was a flat screen TV in our room, this was more modern than the 5star hotel we stayed at in LA the night before!! We did a number of touristy things and ended up practically driving past the motel en route to the next activity on a number of occasions, it ended up being a great place based on our itinerary. Gaslamp district nightlife is around $20 in a cab. Again, the the staff were great. They really made the stay pleasant and we will stay next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful motel, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jshep25
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Dolphin Motel based on their Tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. My husband and I were in Carlsbad visiting my sister but we needed a room in San Diego because we were flying out of the San Diego airport very early in the morning. I wanted to get a room near the airport without paying downtown prices. The motel was great. The rooms are small and sparse but VERY clean. The motel is right across the street from the harbor and within walking distance of several nice restaurants. The staff was very nice and gave us some wonderful advise on where to go and what to see in San Diego (our last day in town). I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Patrice B
Reviews.Content: I discovered Dolphin Motel last year while taking a walk on Scott street during my annual trip to San Diego. This year I decided to try it and I realized that I should have tried it before. My first impression while checking in is the nice welcome from Tom at the front desk. All the staff here are very polite and always do their best to accommodate the guests. Mr Murdock, the owner, asked me if all was correct with my room and kindly gave me advices and tips to make my trip to San Diego more pleasant. The rooms are small but very clean and well kept with a big flat-screen TV, a fridge and air-conditioned. The beds and pillows are comfortable. This motel is also well located, close to the airport and easily accessible by public transport buses. The free breakfast served from 6 to 10 AM includes fresh coffee, tea, muffins, bananas, yogurt and orange juice. Stayed from Sept. 26 to Oct. 1, 2011 and I will certainly return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Just loved it”
Reviews.Author: Thomas N
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Dolphin Motel starting on the 14th of September. The room was super clean, the bed was one of the best we ever had at any establishment and the service was wonderful. A very attentive staff that always enquires how you are doing and how your San Diego visit has been. We have been coming to SanDiego for over 40 years and have never recommend a motel as much as the Dolphin. Quiet and great location with fantastic rates. We will be back again and again. If you don't give it a try you are missing a wonderful experience. -- Tom and Diane Nelson

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: eliza111
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at The Dolphin Motel for 2 nights and just loved it ! Cute room, super clean and had a nice balcony in front of room for sitting and watching boats go by in the harbor. It is located on the corner of Harbor drive which was great as we took a beautiful and easy drive all the way around past parks and marinas and the naval ships. We did a lot of sightseeing around Coronado, La Jolla and San diego and this was a perfect "home base". Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be!!”
Reviews.Author: Fiorellino_azzurro
Reviews.Content: Amazing service, the owners were make you feel at home. They help you with EVERYTHING!! We were amazed with how wonderful they are. Also the place is near the Marina and in a very nice area. You have many restaurants in walking distance. Highly recommended :)

Reviews.Title: “Dolphin Motel - Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: daydreamer101
Reviews.Content: The dolphin Motel, where to start? Budgets were not my main motivator when booking this motel, despite its very very reasonable rates, it was the trip advisor ratings that clinched the deal. My criteria for a hotel/motel is clean safe and friendly, im there to see the city NOT to sit in a room or by a pool (I can do that at my local leisure centre). The Dolphin had reviews by the page full stating my criteria would be hit, they utterly smashed it! From our first steps into the reception both my wife and myself knew this was going to be a great stay. To my discredit I forget the staff members names but suffice to say they will be the same ones that get talked about so positively in all the other reviews. These unsung staff members were fantastic, without being over the top, what Iâ€™d call fake US hospitality. Nothing was a problem, not that we had any issues for them to solve. Vouchers for local attractions, deals at the local Mexican (DO NOT MISS IT) and all the maps youâ€™ll ever need were supplied without hesitation. The rooms, wellâ€¦.they are exactly as the web site says. Click on their home page, go to room pictures and only book if they meet your requirements. Anyone on here moaning about â€œsmallâ€� rooms in my opinion didnâ€™t do their homework and therefore their comments are null and void. They are spotlessly clean, comfortable and perfect for our needs, the needs being to SLEEP. Concerns about TV volume controls from other reviews seem odd to say the least, quite why people need to set up a home cinema experience while on holiday baffles me. We went to bed, watched the news at normal volumes, woke up and watched the news before breakfast what else could you need?? Perfect. The breakfast was as you would expect, please do EXPECT basic. Basic does not mean bad, it doesnâ€™t mean you start the day hungry but it does mean youâ€™re not getting the Vegas buffet style â€œno need to eat for 3 daysâ€� event. A muffin, a banana and an amazing cup of coffee (use the vanilla cream! â€“ it always seemed to be hidden in the fridge) was the order of each day. If you need more there are options just over the road â€“ just remember the price you paid for your room! My only comment that could be construed as slightly negative is the motels location from what us Brits would call the city centre. We didnâ€™t book a car and potentially thatâ€™s our fault but we did assume that being the United States of America your public transport would â€œkick our [--]â€� it did not. The bus stop is a 20 second walk â€“ perfect! The wait for a bus, hmmm not so great. In retro spec I would 100% recommend a car hire OR a fat wallet for a taxi, as the wait was just unbearable on occasions. The issue is exaggerated 100 fold come the evening. We liked to go out on the evenings to the Gaslamp area (check it out!!) but getting back was a nightmare whilst trying to use public transport. The trolly system is ok (ish) but come the end of the line your dumped in what seems like the middle of nowhere. All of this is NOTHING to do with the Motel, but I wouldnâ€™t want people to go to this great establishment and get disillusioned by the transport woes. To surmise, a epic motel thatâ€™s clean, safe, friendly and supremely priced. Go educated and youâ€™ll enjoy every second of it (sorry for the waffle im still jet lagged)

Reviews.Title: “Good motel - basic, but very clean and in great location”
Reviews.Author: cottyh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband from 7th - 11th September. We were originally booked in from 6th, but due to delays on our first flight into Atlanta, we didn't get to San Diego until 7th. The staff were fine about this and kept our harbour view room open for us. The motel is an older property and the rooms are small however the price, location, cleanliness and staff all make this a place we would not hesitate to return to if we came back to San DIego. The motel is within walking distance to some nice restaurants, less than five minutes drive from the airport and only 10 minutes drive from downtown and the Gaslamp area. The breakfast isn't fancy - muffins, yogurt, fruit, coffee, tea and juice - but the muffins were someof the nicest I've had and it did the job and saved us paying out each morning for food. The owner took time to recommend places we should see and provided a map to help us get there. We were in San DIego during the blackout and were glad we were at this motel. We didn't have any problem getting into our room as we had a key not an electronic key card, we didn't have a lift to get stuck in, the boats in the harbour opposite provided some light and the owners distributed torches (flashlights) for use in the rooms. They even gave food to people who had arrived late and not had a chance to buy any earlier in the evening. It was the personal touches like this that made this a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff-basic motel”
Reviews.Author: love2travel4242
Reviews.Content: very friendly helpful staff in a basic clean motel in a good location. the breakfast was adequate. there was some room noise -wall are thin but it was not a big issue. i rented a bike and had it delivered for free to the hotel-ask the staff on booking for details. its a good value for a bottom rung place

Reviews.Title: “A little treausure near the shore.”
Reviews.Author: Joe J
Reviews.Content: We only booked our room here based on other Tripadvisor reviews and boy were we NOT disappointed. First of all the room was $66 including tax. Now we are not travelers that travel on a budget but when a good deal is right in front of us, we take it! Do not be scared by the low price because this hotel staff did more for us then any $300 room we have had. The room was clean aqnd the location was quiet. We are the type of people that just want a clean room because we do not travel to stay in the hotel. We just need it to sleep and get ready. THIS IS THE SPOT! They gave us a free GPS to use when we rented out car and the free little breakfast outside was actually a nice bonus as well. Fresh muffins coffee and Trader Joe orange juice! There is also yogurt and some fruits and it is all fresh. The location was also great! 5 minutes from the airport and downtown and you can walk to many great restaurants. Just perfect for us! I will be telling all of my friends about this place!

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: So_Cal_Illini_81
Reviews.Content: I don't mean my title to be negative, but I want to be realistic. The reason to stay in this motel is the price. I stayed there this last weekend (Sept 2011) while attending a conference at the convention center downtown. I paid less for the three nights I stayed at the Dolphin than I would have paid for 3 nights in a hotel next to the convention center, especially when figuring in the free parking and free wi-fi at the Dolphin. The motel is very old and it shows it's age. All of the structural parts of the room and especially the bathroom look old. The room was very small. It had a queen bed with about 3 feet of clearance on each side, a nook for a closet, and a bathroom that was 3 by 4 with a shower (no tub) that was like 2 by 4. The carpet, bed, etc did look very clean. There was a new flat screen TV on the wall (27 inch I would guess) and two small night stands with two tiny lamps. No chairs (no room!), but they did provide two luggage racks, a tv tray and a mini fridge. There was also a very bright ceiling light that made it comfortable to read (in bed as it was the only place to be in the room). The room was very bright at night, I could have probably read with the lights off. I had to prop stuff up against the window to help shut out the light. he bottom floor room also had a lot of noise form the room above and the office next door. Breakfast is a tray of costco muffins, some bananas, coffee and OJ. The staff was very nice. It is 15 minutes of a very scenic drive to the convention center/Petco park, etc. There are lots and lots of restaurants within 3 or 4 blocks some of them fast food and some of them nice casual. It is across the street from the sport fishing harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, clean, vintage motel.”
Reviews.Author: Nanohoe
Reviews.Content: Fun little motel. Very clean. Small room with great TV with lots of channels. Good value. Fabulous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value Clean Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Sawwhetowls2
Reviews.Content: The white walls, bed linens and towels make the room and bath feel clean and crisp! Free WIFI, breakfast included, and it is the perfect place for BIRDERS & FISHERMAN going on boat trips across the street at the Fisherman's Landing Marina. Small family owned motel is well run. Personal service is amazing. Awesome restaurant suggestions. Great location and really inexpensive for the location!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, simple serviceable rooms”
Reviews.Author: ysp-ba
Reviews.Content: My brother and sister-in-law recommended this basic motel very near Shelter Island and just across the street from the harbor where they leave on their yearly deep sea fishing trips. We were greeted by a very helpful, congenial fellow, Jeb who throughout our 3 night visit made it more memorable than the motel itself. Actually the motel was memorable in its simplicity, making you realize just what you do and don't need in your 'home away from home" when traveling. The rooms are just big enough for a very comfortable bed, a folding chair, a big flat screen TV on the wall, a couple of small bedside tables with lamps, a small closet (no light which was a tad annoying to me) and your basic tiny bathroom, shower no tub but great water pressure (always a plus for my husband). There is a room AC which is fairly noisy when on. If you just want outside air and leave your window open, there is both street, other vacationers and sometimes airport noise. WiFi is free but my husband had trouble at times connecting his iPad. The folks at the desk at one point generously gave him the use of their laptop! You won't find all kinds of specialty bath items in the bathroom, such as lotions, shoe shine stuff etc. BUT if you forgot your toothpaste or run out (as I did) or need a straight razor or other toiletries or even a hair dryer, they have them for you at the office. The room comes with breakfast which consists of good coffee, hot water for tea and tea bags, Yoplait yoghurt in the fridge and when we were there, daily muffins - big and for me overly sweet. Since my husband and I are trying to watch our carbohydrate intake, we tried to find other places close by for breakfast, the closest being the one on Rosecrans connected to the Holiday Inn, I think it was. I think it was called the Point Loma Cafe. We had breakfast there 2 of our three mornings. It was adequate, a sort of glorified Denny's, not cheap but you could find all kinds of egg dishes and the portions were huge. The last morning we decided to find another place for breakfast which I would recommend highly. The Living Room Coffeehouse, 1018 Rosecrans. I think you could walk there but we drove. I will write a special review of this place because I want to give it 5 stars for the delicious food at an incredibly reasonable price. All this said, we went by the Ramada Inn next door to compare prices - twice as much, no breakfast whatsoever and probably pretty much the same type of rooms although we didn't look. We've spent many a day in San Diego mostly in the downtown area so this area was new to us. We enjoyed it and will think about staying there next time we go.

Reviews.Title: “Dolphin NEVER Fails!”
Reviews.Author: ahoylola
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on recommendation of 2 different sets of friends who had exceptional experiences. The rooms of this motel are well appointed with TV, fridge, A/C and wi-fi. CLEAN, clean CLEAN! Lovely presentation of white linens, comfy beds, excellent bath. Staff is exceptional. The complimentary coffee, juice, muffins in the morning was much appreciated. Walking distance to everything we needed. We will recommend this, and we will be back!!! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have felt more welcome!”
Reviews.Author: brekmom
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were booked to stay at the Dolphin Motel for three days during our "girls getaway." We had chosen the motel because of the tripadvisor reviews, looking for something centrally located, comfortable but reasonably priced. We arrived after a very long, frustrating day of travel in which we had our flight delayed due to weather and later diverted due to mechanical problems, resulting in the loss of most of our first day of vacation. Staff at the motel did everything they could to make us feel welcome and get us back into the "we are on holidays!" mindset. Although our original intention had been to find another hotel with pool and modern amenities for our final two nights, we ended up extending our stay at the Dolphin for the full five days. The room was very basic: beds, bathroom with shower, TV. But anything needed was available from the office, including access to laptop with wireless internet and use of the cellphone with unlimited calling throughout the US. The owner and staff were great resources for locating destinations of interest and although GPS was offered, the hand-drawn maps to various points of interest always got us to our destination. What the rooms late in ammenities is certainly made up for in staff attentiveness.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: ambitiouschick
Reviews.Content: Paid $60/night. Stayed for 2nights. Friendly service,however, I gave it 3stars for service because the water was shut off half hour before check-out.Clean room. Modern tv and a fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 3 times this year at the Dolphin Motel”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay Jungmi W
Reviews.Content: Raised up in Asia and in the Midwest, I got to come out to LA for a job. All of a sudden, my family and friends from Asia and the Midwest wanted to come out and visit me. I knew LA was an OK place to show them around. Also, I knew that San Diego was the place that I can't miss out for sure. So, I looked up a place to stay in San Diego. I came across Dolphin's. The cost and the location seemed to be what I was looking for. After staying at the Dolphin's for the first time this January 2011, I planned a trip with my friend (June 2011), and my parents (July 2011) in San Diego and stayed at the Dophin's. They all loved the experience. Especially, the owner Alan Murdock has been so kind to us. He even took my friends, parents on a ride to the Shelter Island, which is a paradise right next to the motel. If you are looking for an experience to greet visitors from the U.S. and international, Dolphin's is a place you can trust. I know I will be heading to Dolphin's again to see the warm sunshine and the nice people there. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Triggerdog1
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were going on a 7 day fishing trip on a boat across the street at Fishermans Landing. We flew in from Edmonton Canada 2 days before the trip so we could see the sights, having never been to San Diego before. Do not let the low prices of this neat little motel put you off. It is very clean and the fact that it is family run assures that the customer service is kept at a high level. The morning of our fishing trip we had to be across the street by 7AM so we got up at 6. We left our room at 6:30 and found the owner setting up muffins and coffee in the courtyard. He convinced us to sit and chat for 10 minutes and have a bite before our journey. Very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a capital S”
Reviews.Author: Latino69
Reviews.Content: Simple motel, very clean, good beds, fridge in the room, quiet at night and a team at the desk that make you feel very welcome. Thanks Alan, Jebber and the rest!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not again.”
Reviews.Author: Skooter430
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here. It is in a great location, close to everything. But we git what we paid for.......hard beds and uncomfortable pillows. I asked the front desk for more pillows and they were delivered by a housekeeper. Upon her arrival I told her we didn't need stay over service and she said ok. We left for the afternoon to find that they in fact come into our room and gave us new towels. My husband said that at the front desk there is a sign that states they come in every room every day. And that just makes me slightly upset. I work in the hotel business and when a guest states no room service, we do not enter their room under any circumstances and I expect that to be upheld at any other hotel. With that said it wasn't that bad but I def wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean accomodations and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Patti F
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Dolphin Motel especially the helpfulness of the staff. We arrived early and our rooms weren't ready, but the front desk staff quickly had housekeeping get our rooms ready and it wasn't too long of a wait at all. While checking in we asked for ideas to spend the afternoon and were given lots of options as well as maps with highlighted areas of interest. We also asked about places to eat and were directed to go to Phil's barbeque (about a 5-10 minute drive)....I would highly recommend eating there! All in all the stay was comfortable. The rooms are a bit small, but definetly clean with all white linens, and you can't beat the rates!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leitha H
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Dolphin Motel were very accomodating....The rooms were so clean you could eat off the floor....The rates were reasonable and I just cannot say enough how nice the staff was...They do not allow ice chests in the room, and the reason being is someone went fishing a while back and brought the fish in the room and gutted and fileted them, in the room!!!I cannot blame the owners to have a no ice chest or fish policy in the room.....Well, where I was going with this is that my Husband and I went fishing, but had them cleaned....We asked if we could keep them, and the night staff let us put the fish in one of their lockers....In the morning we asked if we could check on our fish and re-ice them, and the staff had already checked, and assured us they looked fine....You do't get customer service like this anymore.....I recommend this place to anyone....We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: ladybird0
Reviews.Content: Stayed in July 2011. Very clean and simple. Yes rooms are small but this shouldn't matter if you are out sightseeing. We weren't driving at this part of the holiday but bus stop is pretty much around the corner from the motel. You will have to make a few changes to get most places though! Quiet location therefore good sleeps! What definitely makes this motel is the staff. It's a system that seems to work perfectly. Reception, management, cleaning staff all seem to put effort into their jobs and it pays off. it's so nice to see! They couldn't do enough for you and they take pride in their business, some big hotels could learn lessons. We borrowed a hair-dryer from hotel when we were there - I note an earlier review says this was not possible. We travelled around a variety of hotels and motels during our stay, this was easily the cheapest and definitely one of the best in terms! Holly is a legend!

Reviews.Title: “best price / value, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: fland0
Reviews.Content: The Dolphin Motel is well located and provides clean rooms (small but comfortable and very clean). Staff is very friendly and helpful they would even lend you a GPS if required. Also free WiFi is available. The free breakfast (e.g. coffee, juice, bananas, muffins, yoghurt, McDonald pies) gives you a good start into the day. I would return there immediately again.

Reviews.Title: “clean, friendly & small”
Reviews.Author: pugzx3
Reviews.Content: It was Comicon weekend in San Diego & had a very hard time finding a hotel. We happened upon Dolphin because of trip advisor reviews. We agree with all the reviews. this is a very clean & quaint motel right across from a fishing harbor. The staff was very helpful & friendly. We enjoyed this little motel very much. If there is anything to be said on the negative side it would be that the rooms are VERY small & pretty much no frills. Make sure to bring your own hair dryer & shampoo as they are not provided. No in-room coffee pots either. Not a big deal, but the tv seems to be set on some kind of timer as it shut itself off in the middle of a movie we were watching. Same thing happened the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless clean, friendly and cheap”
Reviews.Author: nananewman
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice motel, conveniently located in La Playa area in San Diego and run by professional and friendly people. We paid $104 (taxes included) for a 2 beds (1 queen and 1 singl), which is a pretty good deal. I would definetively recommend this place to my friends, even the picky ones :)

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Dolphin!”
Reviews.Author: sleater
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an excellent stay at the Dolphin late last year. The motel was located in a very convenient location. The price was amazing!!! We didn't spend a lot of time at the marina, but every place we visited was close by. We had rented a car and there was free parking, which was a bonus. There was also free WiFi which is always an added bonus! The room was immaculately clean, it was on the smaller size, but it had more than enough room for the two of us. The shower pressure was excellent. The daily breakfast of muffins, yogurt, juice and coffee was a nice start to the day. The staff at the motel are very friendly and helpful. Apparently, there are about two to three days of bad weather in San Diego a year...well we were there for all of them. The staff at the Dolphin Motel profusely apologized every time we saw them for the bad weather. It was adorable that they felt so bad about the weather during our visit. The older gentleman gave us an excellent recommendation of an incredibly beautiful drive back to Los Angeles through the mountains via the Sunrise Highway. This is highly recommended! We had already taken the PCH down to San Diego and wanted to see an alternate route. I will definitely come back to stay at the Dolphin Motel next time I am in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop on cross country roadtrip...”
Reviews.Author: amac524
Reviews.Content: We'd definitely recommend Dolphin Motel to anyone! I am a mom & pop motel connoisseur and picked out Dolphin for exactly that reason. The staff is wonderful and very knowledgeable about their area, need directions or ideas? Just ask. Lots of things to do in walking distance. Good breakfast for the busy couple, relax with a bagel and some O.J. The rooms were small, but great for a couple. The only negative thing I could think of, since I'm a girl, is to add shelving in the shower for Shampoo/Soaps. Besides that great room, great value and great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: bougainvilleadesert
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay! The buildings may look old, even with their fresh coat of white paint, but don't let that deter you -- the rooms are very, very clean! They've got the details covered here. Family owned and operated. Super friendly owners and staff. Newer bathrooms. Muffins, bananas, yogurt, OJ, coffee and tea for breakfast. So glad my friend and I found this place. We highly recommend it and will definitely stay there again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: northfieldmn
Reviews.Content: Ditto on all the good things others have written. Four- and five-star hotels can take a cue from the staff at the Dolphin. They walk the walk when it comes to customer service. Tom gave us a tip on where to park for free near Sea World. Jeb told us about a great restaurant down the street (Miguel's--second floor balcony, fantastic view of the harbor at night). If you're there on a Tuesday, check out the fantastic Taco Tuesday at Mitch's Seafood across the street--amazing fish and shrimp tacos! If we return to San Diego, we'll definitely stay at the Dolphin again. Great location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Convenient but Small and fit our needs well”
Reviews.Author: mudballer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights starting June 30. It is close to everything. 10 -15 minute drive max. I was surprised with how small the room was but it was very clean and suited our needs well. Our room had 2 beds, Queen and Single with a nice fridge, air, small bathroom and tv. We didn't need the air being close to the water. We just kept our windows open and was very comfortable. Every morning in the courtyard, they had a nice breakfast set up that consist of muffins, yogurts, banana's, juice and coffee. Every now and then something special was thrown in there like apple pies. Pool area looked nice even though we didn't get a chance to use it. Front desk was very helpful with directions to places and handed out maps. Heck they even offered to let us use the laptop. Overall, I would def stay here again especially for it's charm, price and location.

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: smiles030
Reviews.Content: PROS:- Great Price for SD. I wanted on the beach and motels were 275 up a nite. -Good Location: another review panned the location. I think it's great. it is near the ocean. It is not far from Nimitz on Harbor so great access to SeaWorld and Mission Beach. Great access to the downtown harbor cruises and Midway. 5-10 minutes from the airport. Safe. They have a guard 24 hours with video cam surveillance of the entire property. -Great Service. Family owned and everyone gives you so much help planning your vacation, trips, post office, advice about what to see. Really nice people. -Good continental breakfast: excellent muffins, yogurt, coffee, OJ. That's it but tasty and filling. -Free Parking -Good AC with a refrigerator inside -Soft comfortable bed. If you need stiff bed you won't like it but I found it nice. -Free internet. CONS: -small rooms without furniture other than bed and luggage racks and metal chair. For 1 person with alot of luggage fine. 2 People with alot of luggage each may find them stacking one on top of the other. You will be living out of your luggage. -small bathroom with nonadjustable shower head in small shower. You can't point the shower head at your feet to remove the sand. They need removable european shower heads and it would be oK. Probably drive the price up but this is a useful feature. it is SD and you will be going to the beach and water sports so that would be a nice feature. Crowded bathroom with 1 person inside. But the PROS outweight the CONS. I enjoyed my stay. I would recommend it to friends and I will be back if I can a reservation now that it is so popular.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonable and convient to everything”
Reviews.Author: 31308Bill
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Dolphin Motel. The rooms are small but clean and adequate. They have flat screen tvs with cable. Clean bathrooms and showers. The staff was always friendly and courteous. Very helpful with many suggestions of things to do. They gave us directions to places we wanted to go and friendly conversations. The breakfast was made up of fruit, yogurt, muffins, coffee and juice it was a great way to start the day in their pleasant courtyard, and available at 6AM for us as we are early risers. If you are going fishing at the landings in Point Loma everything is right across the street. The local Restaurants withing walking distance are excellent and if you ask the staff they may even have a coupon for you to use. We loved Miguels Mexican food! They had great food and service. Also, we enjoyed the San Diego Sea Food Restaurant! It had the best sea food in town and both are less that a 5 minute walk.
