The Dolphin Motel offers many extras such as GPS, Hair Dryers, Cell Phones and other needed things that make traveling easier. We appreciated our stays and will stay at the Dolphin Motel whenever we are in town! Great job to all the hard workers at the Dolphn Motel and thanks for making the rooms affordable and clean!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: emmilou27
Reviews.Content: I wish there were more places like this! My boyfriend and I spent 5 weeks traveling around America and of all the placed we stayed this was by far our favorite, better than the 4-5 star places! It's not luxurious but who cares they have so much more to offer! The staff were the best I've ever come across in any hotel, ever! (In America or Australia) They are so kind and welcoming and will go above and beyond to help you with anything you need.Â  They made our stay in San Diego even more wonderful than it already was. We didn't have a problem with the size of the room, it was the perfect size for the 2 of us and our luggage! We stayed in places that cost more and had smaller rooms.Â  There was plenty to choose from on tv, the bed was so comfy and the shower was great, and so clean!! And it doesn't matter that there's no pool, you're only a few minutes drive to some of loveliest beaches America has to offer! Breakfast was great, it was so lovely to sit out in the sun and enjoy a muffin and an orange juice with the staff always there to say good morning, offer the newspaper and make sure everything was ok. We absolutely loved this place and I just can't say enough good things about the Dolphin Motel.Â  WeÂ can't wait to get back to San Diego and stay here again.Â  I would recommend this place to everyone. Awesome staff, great prices, great rooms!

Reviews.Title: “a good deal that is safe for families”
Reviews.Author: gemfly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 1 night with my young daughter, on June 27, 2011. Tom took my phone reservation and also checked us in. He was so nice and went out of his way offering to help us with our bags. We also met one of the owners who made sure we knew about the free breakfast the next morning. (He was even kind enough to remind us as we were checking out). The water pressure was great. I really liked where we stayed. The motel has 2 buildings, we were in the one that is by the office. I liked that it had it's own courtyard and we didn't have car headlights shining into our room. That is also where breakfast is available. The room was very clean. The staff are so nice. The motel is 1 block from the water and close to places to eat. A Denny's is a couple blocks walking distance. The 4 stars for sleep quality had nothing to do with the motel staff/room quality. It was a few noisy people who stayed there and were talking loud at 1am, as they were coming back to their room. Maybe they didn't realize how loud they were, but honestly, the majority of the guests were quiet and considerate. There were not any loud parties or unruly people. I felt very safe with my 6 year old child. I would definately stay here again. It was so affordable. You'll get a smile or happy greeting from everyone who works here. It really does make you feel happy. Thank you for the pleasant stay. We were seeing my sister off for her 3rd deployment and your motel/staff made it very nice for us. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great 50th Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: tciarleglio
Reviews.Content: My Husband, grown children and son-in-law surprised me with a trip to San Diego for my 50th Birthday. They searched and searched and picked your property based on the trip advisor reviews. I always book our vacations because I am a travel agent. I love your property- very clean (I am picky), neat, friendly atmosphere, great staff, a wonderful location and a great price. I can say I will definately recommend this property to my clients that want a clean, safe place to stay at a good price. I know you don't pay commission but I will still recommend it. It was nice to have a refrigerator and flat screen TV in the room. We were in room 28 and 29 and loved sitting out on the balcony to eat our breakfast. The breakfast was something I would have a home- muffins, OJ, yogurt, bananas and coffee. It was just enough to get us going until lunch and not too much! Thank you for that. It was so nice having the free wifi as well- what a nice added benefit! I just wanted to let you know what a great product you have and how much we enjoyed our stay. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Price - Quality it is the best place in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Jessica
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and very helpfull. The restaurants they recommend are very good. The rate is very low. The room is very basic and white. BUT the room is very clean and has everything you need. Free internet and parking. The breakfast is a choice between 2 kinds of muffins. But the muffins are very good. The breakfast is served outside on the patio. If you are ok with a basic room and look for an attractive rate, than this is the place to be. I would remcommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay for a very tight budget”
Reviews.Author: starbright31
Reviews.Content: I've only ever stayed in the downtown and hotel circle areas for my trips to San Diego so when I needed a place that was guaranteed to be less than $100 and nearby the Point Loma area, I was relieved that my friends mentioned this motel to me. At the time I booked my room, I had two options of rooms: they were either $50 or $75 a night. The room with one queen bed was $50 and the one that's got a queen bed and a twin bed was $75. These rooms are a bit small but if you're looking for a clean place to sleep that's walking distance from where you need to go to it's great. I shared the room with a queen bed and twin bed with two friends and it was comfortable enough. It had a small fridge and a surprisingly nice flat screen TV. Their complimentary breakfast consisted of free coffee and muffins. The staff was impeccably kind and eager to help and I really appreciate them calling a taxi for us in the very early morning. If I ever need to stay at the Point Loma area, I'd gladly come back here. It exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “The world's most motivated motel team”
Reviews.Author: sasha079
Reviews.Content: Ok, so its not the Ritz, but it is a motel which will stay in your imagination for a lot longer than a souless big chain. Firstly this is run by a team of highly motivated people, the owner even stopped us in the carpark just to make sure we were going to see all the right things during our brief stay. Needless to stay we were not going to any of these places and were grateful for his 'mud map'. They offer you a gps, mobile phone, suitcase scales and will even print out your boarding passes if you need. The motel is held together by paint and love, it has the big blue dolphin light on the outside along with blue fairy lights. Space is at a premium in the yard, but everthing is put away neatly and this place is so tidy it is scary. Yes the room was small and we did have to stack our suitcases, but it is more the experience than the luxurious motel that you get here. You cannot help but find yourself being caught up by the dedication of these guys. Breakfast was nice, they dont have a breakfast room but it was nice to sit up on the balcony and have our breakfast overlooking the marina. If you just stay one night for the experience it is worth it, they should have tshirts made. I just wish they had a big fat posh hotel to run, the 4 staff could do it with their hands tied behind their backs. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Capt_SEG
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Dolphin are a bit on the small side, but hey, you're in San Diego! How much time are you actually spending in your room?!? The rooms are super clean (I think the house keeper has a personal vendetta against dirt) and comfortable. The family who operates the hotel is extremely accommodating and really go out of their way to make their guest feel welcome. You really are just minutes away from everything you want to do. If you don't have a car, no worries, the Dolphin is on the bus route. This is the ONLY place I will ever stay in San Diego. A great opportunity to "shop local" and support a family run business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Free Parking, Hospitable Staff!”
Reviews.Author: HunterBarney
Reviews.Content: THANK YOU Dolphin Motel for providing a safe, friendly place to stay! The rooms are 'cozy', very clean and relatively quiet. The staff is great, the ocean breeze is wonderful, and I recommend this property to anyone looking for an economical, back to basics getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: Moe_Ipak
Reviews.Content: Well nothing can prepare you for how small the rooms are or how basic they are with the minimum, but what else do you need. It was more then sufficient for the price paid. Free parking is expected at most places, but they also had free wi-fi with great strong signal. The breakfast is simple, muffins, yogurt, bananas, coffee, tea and orange juice. They also gave all the children fresh McDonalds apple pie every morning. Their rooms and the whole property is immaculately clean. It was actually amazing how clean they kept everything. The location is great. They are very accommodating to all your needs. They are very courteous, and friendly. They made sure that everyone hanging out after 9 PM was either quiet, or went back to their rooms. No smoking in the rooms. We would definitely go back to this area. Try it out for yourself, we were surprised that we really didn't need a fancy hotel to have a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: T2M2003
Reviews.Content: We had 3 rooms on May 28, and overall we were happy with the Dolphin motel. Our rooms were small but very clean and the beds were comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful, and they monitored the vehicles in the motel's parking lot overnight. Breakfast was OK, we had Costco muffin, yoplait yogurt, and hot coffee. The owners actually looked much younger than in the picture. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, cheap but small room”
Reviews.Author: Sloane83
Reviews.Content: The Dolphin Motel is a nice place to stay in San Diego. It's cheap, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the room could not have been cleaner. Although we didn't get the best room (which was our own fault because we had a last minute change of plans) and although the walls are thin, we slept pretty well -- only on Saturday night, we could hear the nearby streets a bit too much. The only thing that kept this motel from being excellent though was the size of the room; it felt way too small for two people.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, well located motel”
Reviews.Author: rafa_friends
Reviews.Content: It's an old style motel in a quiet area but close to San Diego downtown or SeaWorld. The location is quiet. Room were really clean and hotel staff is very friendly and ready to help. Breakfast is served at the patio and is very simple but they have the best chocolate muffins I've ever tasted. Free parking. WiFi works fine. There's only two things to complain about. It is slightly pricey and avoid street level rooms direct to the patio. As rooms are not smoking, guests goes outside to smoke and chat just in front of your window and that can be a little annoying while trying to go to sleep. Despite this, I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat $60 on the water!”
Reviews.Author: AirLinguist
Reviews.Content: Was going to Naval Medical Center San Diego and this hotel was highly rated and close by. The hotel looked a little dated but the room was clean and tastefully decorated. Although a bit small we would take the value over size any day. Breakfast the next morning in the courtyard was simple and generous. The owner regaled us with stories of their simple beginnings and told us all the good spots to see in town. This is a jewel hidden away among the big hotels. It almost felt like a bed and breakfast. Go stay with them! DO IT!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Spot!!”
Reviews.Author: OCGirl57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here solely on the reviews we read on this site and we were so happy we did!! Everyone was so nice from our late Friday night check-in to the great hospitality in the morning for our continental breakfast. We stayed two nights. The room was just as described by the other reviews--basic, but immaculately clean and comfy. We drove down from Orange County for the weekend to visit the Zoo and the Midway so we weren't in the room except to sleep, literally, and this suited us perfectly. It is also just a few steps away from the marina. It was really overcast the whole weekend so we couldn't tell how pretty it would have been if it had been sunny, but that didn't stop us from exploring the area. It is conveniently located within minutes of everything you'd want to do in San Diego. We are planning on coming back in the middle of July.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok +++”
Reviews.Author: ianbeale
Reviews.Content: after reading the reviews and seeing what other hotels were in the same ratings , we decided to stay here ...the hotel card given on departure encourages people to post here on tripadvisor ..... the beds were comfy , the flat screen tv was great along with a massive channel choice ,,, they have a no noise on the balcony policy after 9pm , we were told at 815 pm that we had to leave the balcony area and be quiet after 9 pm ... not a problem for us , but ended the fun we were having at 8 oclock ...... the walls between rooms ae quite thin , we could hear the " goings on + coughing " coming from the adjoining rooms ...... sorry if this appears a downer on whats already written ,just statating what we experienced ,, we did enjoy our stay ,.. free internet , high speed , many things free /to borrow .... iron , net help , lap top , and more the staff were most helpful , and did make us feel welcome ... we got what we paid for , a clean room with a few frills

Reviews.Title: “Nice little space, tidy, and in the budget!”
Reviews.Author: jerilynjoyce
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy place but it was perfect for a friend and I that needed a safe clean place to stay on a budget. The morning was topped off with a few tables and chairs to sit outside in the courtyard in the beautiful weather and eat our muffin and drink our juice the hotel provided. Overall this place was just what we needed! The owner said they may be getting some bikes for patrons to take out for the day too so I will be back :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: sbc84
Reviews.Content: Nice place to call home when visiting San Diego. Everyone at the motel is friendly, helpful and service oriented. When my wifi connection was dropping out, the owner upgraded the router service the next day. The location across from the bay is great, and bus service is steps away if you don't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and right by the water”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTravelBug3
Reviews.Content: The Dolphin Motel was basic but cute. It is a typical wharf-side hotel which had a flat screen tv, heater and fridge. The staff were friendly and provided information and a discount for dinner, whilst we were able to walk across to the jetty.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the Best Budget Motel”
Reviews.Author: Rickest
Reviews.Content: Being a ususal Tripadvisor fan I was pleasantly surprised that another Tripadvisor recommendation came through with flying colors. Without a doubt the nicest, cleanest, unscuzzy motel I've ever seen. The Wifey calls it "clean & simple", if you aren't looking for all the amenities. I will definitely recommend for anyone looking a clean environment at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: devonsheepy
Reviews.Content: we had a great syay here for 4 nights. Holly, Alan and Tom and the other chap [sorry I forgot your name] were so helpful and made our trip less stressful trying to find places by looking out addresses for sat nav. .Coming from the uk we found the roads and traffic slightly daunting! rooms were clean, comfortable,and convenient and breakfast was a bonus too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - you should have a look at this motel”
Reviews.Author: busbach
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place in a great, quiet location with a nice ocean view, the Dolphin Motel could be an option for you. It's a family owned motel and the hospitality of the empoyees was really great. Though the rooms a small, they are very clean. The prices are really convenient for what you get. We stayed at this motel for 2 days in February 2011 while on a study trip in the US. I will definitely consider it for future trips to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good old fashion friendly service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: m1dlj
Reviews.Content: Stayed over a week. Very clean. Owners friendly and very helpful. Good parking. WiFi. Good coffee and simple breakfast included. Oh, and plenty of bananas!

Reviews.Title: “Location - Hospitality - VALUE”
Reviews.Author: sisugirl1
Reviews.Content: This little gem located across from a scenic marine harbor is a very welcome place for the simple, budget-minded traveler. Have stayed here 4 times now, (about 2-3 nights each time). Family-owned and operated, the whole staff is super friendly, attentive and helpful. The rooms are small but they have fresh white paint and thick bathroom towels. Comfortable beds and flat screen TV's. Convenient walking to several good restaurants and a very easy route to the airport are other benefits. Thank you, Hawley, and everyone, for always providing us with a pleasurable experience and stay!

Reviews.Title: “San Diego's hidden budget gem!”
Reviews.Author: jaguarariz
Reviews.Content: Twice a year we stay in this wonderful little motel in Point Loma right along the sportfishing waterfront. Rooms are meticulously clean. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. They really made us feel like old friends. The motel owner and his son checked with us every day to make sure everything was as good as they could make it. Definitely THE place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Once again, Thanks for the great stay!”
Reviews.Author: omarmoey
Reviews.Content: Thanks again for a great week stay, we love the dolphin motel..this our second time staying there, my family enjoyed it very much, the service was awesome, special thanks to the front desk staff! I work in the gaming industry and customer service is very important to me and I would to give my compliments, keep up the good work! Moses

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GarakC
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in San Diego. Very clean and confortable rooms. Breakfast was very complete. It is self-service and you can take it on the tables located in the yard. Very nice when the weather helps. The staff was also very helpful. I higly reccommend staying at Dolphin. Unfortunately I had not the chance to check the sorrounding. However, what I was able to see from my car, there is a Marina and many seafood restaurants near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We still talk about this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: karen_dodds
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay at the Dolphin Hotel, the rooms are compact but very clean and cozy, with really good links to public transport. The best part of this hotel is the staff, its family run by the nicest people in the world! They were so helpful and so friendly! We enjoyed every minute of our stay here. I would definately stay here again. A good breakfast is provided in the morning and its only a short walk to several local eateries and/or shops. A big thanks to the hotel owners for our tour of Cabrillo National Monument and Point Loma Lighthouse; we would definately have missed out if it wasn't for you!

Reviews.Title: “Chose this from Trip Avisor and wasn't disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DaveE45
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights while in San Diego sightseeing and playing golf. This is a great basic family motel, and by family I mean family run, father and son an for 34 years! The rooms are clean and white, and whilst not spacious they are fine for a couple. breakfast in the courtyard was a great start to the day. Be sure to ask the office staff for restaurant recommendations and "coupons', we walked to dinner every night in a very safe area and really enjoyed the restaurants we visited. Customer service is their watchword, staff never far away which helped when i had a little tumble one morning, no damage done!! Next time we are in the area we will stay there agian, the value is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Under 60 dollars. This is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: u_callme
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Dolphin Motel in San Diego. I had a great experience there. It is clean, the people are super nice, the location is very convenient and the place is very very inexpensive. I paid less than 60 dollars a night including taxes. There are not many places for that price where you can get a free gps, free internet, free computer if you need it and coffee and muffins and or yogurt in the morning. By the way the coffee was excellent. The next time I come to San Diego I will definitely be staying there again. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “SO nice”
Reviews.Author: Bixou84
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Dolphin Motel ! Very friendly and helpful people, great location, clean room, free wifi... and nice price ! Thanks a lot for this great week in San Diego !

Reviews.Title: “great for military personnel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: socaldudeLB
Reviews.Content: My gf and I are a military couple who frequently stay at Dolphin. (The base doesnâ€™t allow couples). Rooms are not grandiose but we are young and on a budget. I checked around, its got the best price vs quality ratio in town.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome motel”
Reviews.Author: cloud54321
Reviews.Content: Long story short, I recently had a horrible stay in downtown at the Hampton Inn, they usually give me a good room but this time it was in the street corner next to the train tracks! I found this place while doing some browsing. Compared to downtown this area is a lot more quiet and I paid like $50. Itâ€™s American owned and the owner was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to Detail and People Who Care”
Reviews.Author: porphyry
Reviews.Content: My room was clean, bright and just the right size. It included a refrigerator, deluxe TV, high speed internet, generously sized towels, hot shower, and balcony to enjoy the Harbor View. It is so nice to see the friendly, personable owners, (father & son) Holly and Alan on site. They oversee a very well kept motel. Best of all is their talent in hiring immensely likeable people. Steve, Tom, and Jeb are the ones I recall by name. Each of them are uniquely cheerful, quick-witted, respectful, and unfailingly obliging. I love this place, and hope to come back soon!â€¨P.S. You may ask to borrow a GPS compliments of the motel. You will also get fabulous advice on places to see, good food, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel”
Reviews.Author: PeterZoetermeer
Reviews.Content: This motel is really as nice as the other reviews say. We had a wonderful stay there for four nights. Yes, the room was small, but comfortable, clean and equipped with refrigerator and flatscreen tv. The "balcony" with seats is a nice extra. Breakfast with delicious muffins, bananas, orange juice, yogurt and fresh coffee. Very nice view from our room on the second floor. The friendly owners are always there for help and advice. We loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “clean, budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: d_p_richards
Reviews.Content: Very bare bones room, bed was a bit on the hard side - no frills here at all, but service friendly. In room fridge, free wifi, free parking. Free breakfast (yogurt and giant muffins, coffee, and juice) in mornings. Good location - close to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: granmaz
Reviews.Content: Found this great place through Tripadvisor and right away felt the friendliness when the owner and then another member of staff replied to my emails asking advice. We had never been to San Diego before and did not know the best area to stay. Well this was a great area, quiet yet very convenient for anything you might want. The motel is not your run of the mill motel. Yes the rooms are small, but comfortable, clean and well equipped, having a refrigerator and flat screen TV. Also free WiFi!!! The owner Alan, his son, and all the staff we came into contact with were friendly, helpful and very nice people. Alan was around at breakfast offering helpful tips on where to go. The rooms are well taken care of by a very busy lovely lady. The use of the outside corridor as a balcony with seats is an excellent idea, and we sat there with our breakfast every morning overlooking the harbour. Wonderful! You even get breakfast in with the excellent price, coffee, juice and muffins. They will do airline online check in for you and print out the boarding pass!! Thank you, we hope we get the chance to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Friendly”
Reviews.Author: abrum
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed there 5 days. The owner and workers are really friendly. They helped us for everything. They give us a cell phone insipite of missing :)) Alan who owner of the motel borrow us his GPS too. Rooms are not big but clean. The neigbourhood is safety and the price is cheap.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Place to stay in a beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: johnmacmillan
Reviews.Content: The best place to stay. My wife and teenage son had a great time in San Diego And it was because of meeting people like the owners of this motel (Father & Son) and Stephen- the Reception Manager and the lovely Fillipina Lady who has worked there a couple of decades. Man- does that say something when the Staff stay there so long, the loyality the staff have to the owners is something!! I feel the same loyality to this place after just one vacation stay at the Dolphin Motel. I will tell all my friends that you can not go wrong here!! And the rooms were great and at a terrific price. If you want a friendly place to stay ,with spotless rooms and in a great location then this is the place!!! CHEERS John & Patricia

Reviews.Title: “Nice and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: patriciamacmillan
Reviews.Content: Nice staff,always happy to help,nice place to stay,excellent value

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Jobtraklite
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a reasonable motel for a weeks stay. Normally, I would do quite a bit of research. After all it's easy to find a good expensive hotel; but takes more work to find a less expensive one. There was something about the web site that attracted me, so I booked without further ado. We weren't disappointed. I won't waste time talking about the cleanliness and attentiveness of the owner and staff. They've been well covered. The thing I liked about it is the location, just across the street from a marina in between Harbor Island and Shelter Island. Our only transportation was bicycles; and the bike trail along the bay to downtown started only a block from the Dolphin. The bike lane on Nimitz Blvd made it easy to get to Ocean, Mission, and Pacific Beaches, as well as the bike trail around Mission Bay. Tip: The desk clerk tipped us off the first night to Mitch's Seafood practically across the street along the marina. We went back 3 times for the beer battered fish sandwich and fish tacos.

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem!”
Reviews.Author: samsonsmamma
Reviews.Content: This is a must-try motel straight out of the classic 1950's; the premises were in excellent repair & had obviously had lots of consistent TLC. The staff went out of their way to be helpful & make sure we wanted for nothing. Immaculate, bright, upbeat decor, prompt service, comfy beds & continental breakfast (coffee, orange juice & delicious moist muffins) every morning in the cozy courtyard. And the price cannot be beat! Great location on Point Loma in SD. Not a lot of unnecessary frills, but nice touches like a big wide-screen TV, nice soaps, all white linens, small refrigerator in the room. Not a stained towel or sheet in sight. Rooms are small, but so what? We stayed here before our cruise & for 2 nights afterward; would definitely stay here again. Owner let us park the car there while on our cruise. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel with outstanding attributes at an attractive price.”
Reviews.Author: kelvin085
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking to spend several days in San Diego after a Holland America cruise. When I booked the hotel I was concerned that it would not meet our high expectations after being pampered on the cruise for 12 days. Wrong! We totally enjoyed our stay at the Dolphin. The hotel is family operated and owned, employees are treated as members of the family and all are extremely helpful, supplying coffee and pastries for breakfast and no end of helpful travel information. The hotel has a fantastic quiet location overlooking the marina and a short walk to many good restaurants. Good neighbourhood with Security is 24/7 which is a big PLUS! For those without a car, a bus route is steps away. Taxi service to the cruise terminal is about 15 minutes, cost $11 with tip. Minutes to airport and many attractions. Coming from the cruise to the hotel we wanted an early check-in, not a problem, this allowed us to spend more time being a tourist. This hotel is listed as # 22 out of 249 hotels but deserves a higher rating when all the benefits are considered. We must congratulate Horace and Steve on a well run hotel. Bob and Verna

Reviews.Title: “Cosy place!”
Reviews.Author: kaylen
Reviews.Content: The rooms aren't that spacious but I'm totally fine with that considering that the price of the room beats everything. It's is definitely very clean! And the staffs are warm and friendly! I met this guy who works there (I think he's the owner but I'm not so sure) over breakfast and he was really helpful to offer me insights as to where my family and I should visit over our stay in San Diego. He even provided maps to various attractions in SD! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Destination”
Reviews.Author: LeilaJean
Reviews.Content: The location is awesome...right across the street from the harbor, great safe neighborhood, easy walk to restaurants and Shelter Island. Old town is 10 minutes away. Short drive to Cabrillo National Monument...a must see. The views are breath taking. The staff is absolutely great...just like the reviews have stated. I did not look for things to do before arriving after reading the previous reviews. I just asked at the desk and they did a great job of recommending places to see and things to do. All we had to do was just show up and they took care of everything. The rooms was very very clean. The linens on the bed smelled so fresh. Every morning on my way to the Harbor my coffee was frershly brewed and waiting for me along with fruit and muffins. I had a great view of the Harbor from my second floor room. We stayed in room 36. The sunrise views over the mountains and the Harbor were spectacular. We always go with TripAdvisor when we are looking for a place to stay in a new destination and would have to say that this was our best find as of yet. We look forward to returning here. Thanks again to the staff at the Dophlin Motel.

Reviews.Title: “Best little motel I've ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: DesireeOtero
Reviews.Content: Across from the fishing docks (my husband's favorite place in the world) is this superb little motel...sparkling clean, beautiful bedding, excellent customer service, coffee and muffins in the morning. We've stayed there many times and it only gets better...sparkling white rooms, flat screen TV's and friendly. We checked in there this year on Christmas day since my husband was leaving for 10 day fishing trip early the 26th...perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly place”
Reviews.Author: Huligina
Reviews.Content: Spent only one night at the Dolphin but was impressed with it. As most previous reviews stated, the place is super clean and centrally located. The owners have made the most of the small rooms by adding shelves to keep things handy which makes a huge difference. The bed was super comfortable, the shower was terrific, and theTV and large number of channels were great (especially since the weather did not cooperate while we were there). The WiFi was also terrific. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews don't lie!”
Reviews.Author: Soko_G
Reviews.Content: The Dolphin Motel was exactly as described. Clean rooms, great view of the harbor and Point Loma, friendly owners and staff. The proximity to Shelter Island for walking or to Bus 28 to get you to the Old Town trolley/bus station is key. They even had an international adapter for my friend from overseas. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This Motel was great”
Reviews.Author: nightstar47
Reviews.Content: I just want to say that my daughter and I stayed in this motel over 4th of July for 4 nights. The Staff was great and very helpful. The rooms were very clean and well kept. I loved the rates. This is a motel I would recomment to anyone. As a matter of fact I will be calling them tomorrow to see if they have any rooms available for Friday thru Tuesday of next week.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: babbleor
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Dolphin Motel was wonderful. I have never met a more friendly or helpful staff - very much a "can-do" attitude! Sure, there are plenty of places that are fancier - bigger rooms, elaborate furnishings and elaborate breakfasts, but the Dolphin is more than adequate, and even better than some of the ultra high end hotels I've "splurged for" in the past. I will be happy to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “This little motel is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: audreymahoney
Reviews.Content: Here I thought they were so gracious and accomodating to my daughter and me was because we are so nice - but from all the other reviews I've read since arriving home, they're simply that way to all their clients! We were with them for a week, and the owners and the entire staff were always helpful. The reviews ratings on cleanliness, location, etc. are true, and the coffee is excellent, too! We'd go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Caring Staff, Clean Room, Great Price-Save Time and Money By Staying Here First!”
Reviews.Author: shabrick
Reviews.Content: The prices at this motel may seem a little high when you first look into the rooms here. However, after you to look around, you will realize that you wont find any that are cleaner and more hospitable, and yet also cheaper than this place. We are from the midwest and are used to Indiana's cheap motel prices (39.99-49.99). While visiting San Diego, we stayed in a couple hotels/motels before coming to the Dolphin. The first night we stayed at a Ramada ($150 per night), and while on a day trip to San Clemente we first checked out a local mom and pop inn and inquired about the rate. They wanted $80 per night but did not include cable or internet, so we had to stay at a Holiday Inn for ($170 per night). Our 3rd night back in San Diego, we agreed we couldn't afford to keep shelling out the high prices for these Southern California hotels. I happened to run across the Dolphin's website while doing a search for cheap San Diego motels. The website had us a little cautious and apprehensive but agreed we would give it a try. MY DOLPHIN REVIEW To secure the room, they do require you to use your credit card over the phone and pay for the first evening, but allow you to make a decision after the first night if you want to continue staying each additional night. We were given a second floor room in the main building, in the corner of the balcony. (Side Note: If you have disabilities like the second member of our party, this motel does not have elevators, so you will have to request downstairs room if available.). I asked how to access the pool from the pictures, and was disappointed to find out that the pool actually belongs to the neighboring hotel and therefore the Dolphin does not have a pool. WIth the negatives out of the way now, I am free to tell you about all the positives about the Dolphin that have left us with certainty of coming back. Upon check in, the staff asks if you brought a laptop with you. If you have, they will supply you with a wi-fi code to access their internet. If you have left your laptop at home, they have complimentary laptop for you to use at no additional charge. There is a privacy fence that blocks the downstairs rooms' views, but having the room we did on the second floor, we couldn't have asked for a better room with a view. From our balcony, we had a perfect view of the harbor and and yachts at Sport Fishing Landing across the street. As for the service you get at the Dolphin, you cannot ask for anything better. The staff here really care about their guests. From the night clerk we checked in with, to the actual owners that work the desk and take care of continental breakfast duties, service is top priority here. One owner asked if he could carry our bags to our room for us. This kind of service is something you don't get at other chains. The rooms are a bit small. We had one queen bed and one twin bed in the room, which only left a walk way around each bed. While the rooms may be small, you wont find a cleaner room elsewhere. Everything in these rooms is white, and the staff ensure that it stays that way. The showers at the Dolphin had great water pressure and never ran out of hot water, which was a plus compared to the other hotels we stayed at. Each morning there are large sized muffins and juice available downstairs near the lobby, free of charge. All in all, the Dolphin is a great value with great service and clean rooms. If you are like us, we don't spend much time in the rooms while on vacation, so how clean it is and how we are treated is what means more than anything, and this place delivers on that. AREA ATTRACTIONS/RESTAURANTS The Dolphin is in a great location. With everything nearby, we returned our rental car after the first night here. Within walking distance (2 blocks) there is a great restaurant (Miguel's) which the staff can give you coupon for free appetizer, a great white cheese sauce that is superb. If you prefer a hot breakfast over the free continental served, just around the corner is a donut shop that also serves plate size croissants for same price you would pay at Burger King. There are plenty of dining options in the area. Although we did not go to any of the bars/clubs, there are a few within a couple blocks if that is your scene. GETTING AROUND Just behind the motel, you can hop on the MTS bus line that will take you all the way to Old Town (Main transport area), which you can then access the different trolleys or other bus lines to take you to other areas of San Diego. Before you get to Old Town though, there are many stops at area shopping centers along Rosecrans Street. You will come to find, just as we did, that a car was not needed after you get to the Dolphin, as its location is near everything you need. Concluding..The Dolphin actually made our stay in San Diego the best part of our trip. We were able to save money on the room to use for other activities in SD, but not sacrifice room quality. You won't find a more caring staff anywhere else. What you really need in a room is someplace quiet that you can get a good night sleep, with great service and clean rooms. The Dolphin more than delivers on that! WE WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK! -Wanda & Shawn from Greenfield, Indiana

Reviews.Title: “Dolphin delivers clean, basic and convenient room.”
Reviews.Author: Bajadock
Reviews.Content: Sheet thread counts? Mini bar? Movie channels? Potpourri? Time and temperature projected on my ceiling? Bath soap in wrapping paper fit for a mother's day present? No frilly accessories needed for me, thanks. My first stay at the Dolphin last week before a 6AM flight was comfy. Clean & firm bed, a clean bathroom with hot, pressured water, wifi internet, quiet sleep and morning coffee available are all that I need in a room. Dolphin provided all of that, a wakeup call, and an airport taxi call. Many would describe my room at the Dolphin as spartan college dorm style. I don't spend much time in my room when traveling. There was plenty of service from the staff. That included answering all of my questions via email when I was selecting my room, as well as doing their best during my brief stay. Ilikeit and will be back for my next early morning flight out of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “a very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: lindabrewer
Reviews.Content: this was our second time to stay at your motel and we really enjoyed or time there ,it was very close to all we wanted to see. the staff was very helpful and efficient to all our needs,and enjoyed being able to have coffee and muffins at in the early morning all in all we had a very enjoyable stay , thank all the staff and owners for there hospitality. we would not hesitate to stay there again..thank you all Joe and Linda Brewer / Mesa,Arizona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: fuzzypuppy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel because I wanted a reasonable place to stay during Comic-Con. I was definitely not disappointed and I would stay here again. If you had a car the location was excellent for Comic Con as well, just straight down Harbor Drive. (Mind you, for that to be an actual benefit, you need to buy your Comic Con parking vouchers months in advance) The room was a little dated but that's not really what I look for in a hotel. It was very clean and the staff were all very friendly and very helpful. They always asked if I was satisfied or if there was anything else they could do to help. The breakfast was pretty good, too. On a side note, there were thankfully no parking oddities at this hotel. This seemed to be a recurring problem throughout my road trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value; super staff”
Reviews.Author: Gullible88
Reviews.Content: Really helpful and friendly owners and staff. Basic accommodation but everything you really need at about half the price of nearby "name" hotels. Simple breakfast very welcome and was there at 5.30 when we woke early due to jet lag on first night. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good price, basic, and right across from fisherman's landing.”
Reviews.Author: retiredCDF
Reviews.Content: I go on long range fishing trips out of fisherman's landing. The rooms are small but super clean and comfortable. I feel very safe do to the 24 hour desk and outside surveillance cameras. If your going out for a fishing trip or your looking for a quiet place to stay, I would recommend the Dolphin. Cable TV but you must ask the desk for a alarm clock. continental breakfast is provided in the morning. The staff and owners are very friendly and are there to help. I'll be going back this week.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and inexpensive!”
Reviews.Author: HShenk-Opatich
Reviews.Content: The rooms were extraordinarily clean. The staff was very kind, personable, and helpful! And the price is right! Remember this is not a destination motel. This is a clean, hospitable, inexpensive place to sleep while spending time in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice location.”
Reviews.Author: lelici49
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in september on our roadtrip. The rooms were small(especially the bathroom) but we knew that because of your reviews, but clean, comfy bed, fridge and lcd tv. What more do you need when your only there to sleep?? The breakfast (coffee, muffin, yoghurt) was a bonus. The owners were very friendly and helpfull, as were the guys at the check-inn desk. Hi, Tom Huynh!! One day i saw a sign which said "please be quiet before 9am and after 9pm". The next day however 4 people checked in to the room next to us at 11.45pm, and started showering till 1.30am. Unbelievable, who does that in a motel???? I mentioned it to the owner, and he talked with these people. On the other hand if you put up a sign with the above text, you should not alowe people to check in after 9pm, let alone at midnight! Overal we had a very nice stay in a family owned motel in a great location. We even wanted to stay another night, but the motel was fully booked. I gues that says it all!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST DEAL BY THE BAY”
Reviews.Author: elmer1975
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights, then came back after traveling up the coast to stay for 2 more nights. Our room was spotless, the owners were like family, and right in front of our room was the bay with the best seafood restaurant. I would recommend The Dolphin Motel to anyone that wants a wonderful place with yesterday prices.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: FrancesLee
Reviews.Content: We were touring on motorbikes and spent 3 nights here. We had a wonderful time everyone was friendly and helpful giving us information on bus stops and places to visit. We found it amusing having the breakfast area outside, as coming from the UK this would never be an option. We made use of the balcony outside our friends room for afternoon nibbles and wine, which we bought locally and cheaply. The buses were very easy to use and a fraction of the tour trolley bus price. We bought a 2 day pass from the Tourist info for $9 each for unlimited travel on all buses and trams. we went to the Zoo and Old Town also the harbour area well worth the money. The rooms were smaller than we had experienced in other areas but we only used them to sleep in and we slept reasonably well. Dad was concerned that a group of lads had disturbed our sleep and appologised he also had his own way of dealing with them. We were lucky to see the fishing boats come in early one morning so we wandered over to the harbour and watched the weigh in of Tuna and other weird and wonderful fish a great experience. We wished we could have stayed longer and when we arrived at our next destination really did wish we had. Thanks to all staff and family we met whilst at your establishment.

Reviews.Title: “great value, thank you for a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: SweetCountryWoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 32 for 8 nights. We felt very comfortable and safe because management & all staff are so friendly and helpful, on duty 24 hours. Room and bathroom are small, the walls thin, but clean, with big refrigerator, flat screen TV, free WiFi and in the morning free coffee & muffins. Thank you for a very pleasant stay in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel- kind of neat, but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: TheHappiestWanderer
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this motel. I have to say that after reading the reviews I had higher expectations for the hotel than what I ended up experiencing. There were many people to assist us when we arrived, and they were all very friendly and made sure to take steps to make us happy; however, I honestly feel that the room itself could be improved a bit. Probably one reason that they can charge so little is that they have not made as many efforts as they could to renovate the rooms. The shower was pretty nice, but the bathroom was very small- I guess I don't see how they could do much to change that. I was able to sleep pretty well on the bed, but the mattress pad or something made it feel kind of "papery," if that is a word. The room was not impeccably clean as some of the reviews have said- I found random hairs scattered around the room in the corners, on the ledges, etc. I have been to similarly priced motels where the room was cleaner upon arrival. I feel that this is something that can be controlled while still charging a nice affordable price, and I would also recommend some renovations in the near future- especially the carpeting. The carpeting was very worn, & didn't quite go all the way to the wall (kind of curled up on the edges). It is kind of a pleasant little hotel/nice location, but I have to agree with the review that someone previously wrote- "You get what you pay for." "Average" is not "bad"- it is "average," and that is how I am rating this hotel. Based on what I look for in a hotel, I would not recommend this motel to my friends, unless I knew that they were not very picky.

Reviews.Title: “Love. Love. Love.”
Reviews.Author: starhasher
Reviews.Content: I loved the Dolphin. You cannot beat this price with the location. Minutes from everything - beaches, downtown, eating airport, etc. The staff is first rate and were so accommodating. They even fed you breakfast. My favorite was enjoying the great weather and relaxed atmosphere in the morning whilst drinking coffee, eating muffins and browsing the internet (free wi-fi) and planning my day. That's what vacations are about. No hassles and this place was trouble-free. It's not fancy but for as much as you hang out at your hotel/motel while on vacation, it had all your needs met as well as a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: lil_star04
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as we were going to concert Pros: The staff were very friendly Breakfast/parking is free Inexpensive Cons: The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything in the rooms next door Very cramped, small rooms. Rooms do not feel safe or secure enough My partner also cut himself with something on the bed. There was about 30 mins of slight panic whilst we tried to find the offending item. It turned out to be the pillow zip. We were not happy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff treated us like family”
Reviews.Author: dradfan
Reviews.Content: This motel was close to where we wanted to be and was very clean. What makes the Dolphin Motel stand out is the warmness and professionalism of the staff. They accommated our every request without hesitation. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't have found a better place to stay in San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: ecoli70
Reviews.Content: Nice place, clean rooms, convenient location, cheap rates but what really makes the difference is the staff. They are very helpful and really really nice people. We planned a 3 nights stay we endend with a 7 night stay. It was like home. We'll definitely go back one day. Thanks again to the Dolphin's staff. Enrica e Giovanna from Italy

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay in our time of need. Thanks for making us welcome.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Dolphin Motel in Point Loma from El Cajon region in San Diego. This was the best decision of our trip. Rooms are extremely clean with big tv, nice shower. Staff are extremely helpful and make you feel very relaxed. Location is great. One minor weakness was the noise in the morning. We were outside the breakfast area and heard other people talking, but it's better than smelling weed like in El Cajon! Walls are slightly thin, but besides that it was a brilliant stay and we wanted to stay in San Diego longer! Thanks for a brilliant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Comfortable, and Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: Thomcatla
Reviews.Content: We were visiting San Diego for one night to catch a pre-season Chargers game. I had searched for hours online for hotels and was finding only outrageous rates. Then I stumbled across the Dolphin Motel on Tripadvisor. Even though it was after midnight, I was able to telephone the hotel and to book a room. Our room was fairly small, but it was spotless, and it included a mini-fridge and free wi-fi service. The trolley that we took to Qualcomm Stadium was just a short drive (or bus ride) away. The staff was helpful, and the motel is located in an attractive part of San Diego. This place is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “best value for your dollar by far!!!”
Reviews.Author: craftypg
Reviews.Content: Met with up with my daughter coming in from AZ after finding this place on the internet. Easy access to so many wonderful places in the San Diego area! The owners were more than helpful as well as the front desk clerks. Very friendly and you felt welcome here. We would come back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for the great hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: omarmoey
Reviews.Content: Awesome place, I was looking for quick inexpensive place in SD and this place came up, for my sons bday weekend, first of all this place is only for the budget concious folks, if you are looking for fancy, this is not for you, the rooms are very clean, killer view of the yatchs from the top floor, and the nice patio to enjoy the complimentary muffins, coffee and juice we did not have any milk for my sons cereal,I asked the owner if they had any for sale there, he said no, next thing you know, we had milk at our front door brought over by him! (very cool!) Love the 5 star treatment and attitude, without the price!! I love San Diego...we will be back..Thanks Again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little motel”
Reviews.Author: townB
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a few days during the second half of July 2010. Mainly the motel was a base for us while we visited San Diego's main attractions: Sea World and San Diego Zoo. We found the motel to be more than adequate. Some of the positives of the Dolphin include: great service and hospitality (the staff members were always happy and willing to help, the owner even gave my partner and I a ride out to Point Loma to see the Fort Rosecrans Cemetery and the Cabrillo National Monument). They provide a nice little breakfast for free in the morning which include muffins, yoghurt, orange juice and a few other things. The rooms are very clean, have a good sized LCD TV, free wireless internet and the showers are hot and have great pressure. The motel is in quite a convenient location as it is a short bus or taxi ride from the city centre or other San Diego attractions and it is also within walking distance of smaller shops and food (including Pizza Nova which is amazing). Only a couple of negatives which should not play much in the decision to stay here: the rooms are quite small and at times can seem a little cramped if you have a lot of luggage. Beds are double beds, which is a little too small if you are tall (such as myself) and are sharing the bed with someone else. I would highly recommend staying here no matter what your intended business in San Diego. The prices are extremely competitive (take note prices double around the time of Comic-Con) and provide good bang-for-you-buck.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, and service- super clean too!”
Reviews.Author: hardrockingirl
Reviews.Content: My bf and I decided to stay here while we vacationed in SD after reading all the positive reviews. We are so glad we did! First of all, the price can't be beat. The other hotels with similar pricing was either too far from attractions or had bad reviews of being dirty or having bad service. The rooms were VERY clean and I am SUPER picky when it comes to cleanliness. The bathroom was spotless. The location was great. We were less than 15 minutes from everywhere we wanted to visit. The service was friendly and attentive. The very nice gentleman that owns the hotel introduced himself to us, and recommended we visit the Cabrillo National Monument. We did and we loved it! The front desk was very helpful with directions and recommendations. There were a few minor annoyances. The room was tiny. The TV would shut off occasionally if you changed the channel. There wasn't any clocks. The two mirrors in the room and bathroom were very small. I couldn't check my clothes. A full length mirror would be great! But these are very minor. Overall we were very pleased. We enjoyed looking out our window and seeing the harbor! We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great little motel!”
Reviews.Author: lomati27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on one of the many stops of our trip and was very impressed with this little motel. Clean and bright, the rooms are small but are perfectly serviceable because when your San Diego - what are you doing in your room?! The shower though was fabulous! Free intermittent wi-fi, we didn't try breakfast so cannot comment on that. The harbour outside is lovely and within driving distance to the Old Town which is a must see in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good value for money”
Reviews.Author: LightMatt
Reviews.Content: If your are looking for luxury this is not the place for you. But if you want a clean and extremely cheap accomodation in San Diego it's perfect. It also has free WiFi connection!

Reviews.Title: “Best place for visiting San Diego on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: FoxtonCarl
Reviews.Content: Small, old fashioned family run motel. Quiet location right by the sport fishing boat harbour. Near to airport but no night flights (7am earliest). Good continental breakfast included, served in the courtyard, but no nearby food outlets other than a pricey sea food place on the dock. Very helpful staff allowed use of a computer for checking emails.

Reviews.Title: “Tom Bodette is jealous of Dolphin Motel”
Reviews.Author: DowntownSteve
Reviews.Content: Tom Bodette only wishes he could provide clean comfortable rooms like Dolphin Motel. You will rarely have the opportunity to stay at a place like the Dolphin Motel. First off this is very much a no frills place. Nothing fancy here folks. You will find the Dolphin in an excellent location, steps from the sea, fishing boats, dining options, and cute homes. Enough can't be said about the staff, homey, and genuinely friendly. You will likely meet the owner, I chatted with him several times. This is an older, well maintained place that is extraordinarily clean. You can practically eat off the floors inside and out. Parking is included with your room rate too. The rooms are fairly small, glossy white walls, frig, a place to hang clothes, shower with wildly high water pressure...you could power wash your boat with this thing. No tub. The walls are thin, you will hear your neighbors on occasion, this is a quiet place though, and will not pose a problem for most. A modest breakfast is provided near some outdoor tables, with umbrellas, it can be a very laid back sociable scene if you choose to get involved, or you can relax in solitude. Bottom line, for the price, location, cleanliness, and hospitality, you will seriously have a hard time beating this place. Although this is far from a 5 star hotel, for the price and everything else considered, I give it 5.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: mimaza1
Reviews.Content: When we tried to book a hotel room for our one night stay in San Diego, I contacted a travel agent to find us a good deal. The bargain she found for us was $160 per night in a decent hotel near Seaworld. As all we were looking for was a clean, safe place to crash for the night, I decided to do a little search of my own and I am glad I did. I stumbled upon this hidden gem on tripadvisor. This quiet little motel cost us less than half of my travel agent's bargain. The rooms were clean and the customer service impeccable. I highly recommend this place and I myself will stay there without second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: TwoShedsJackson30
Reviews.Content: This place is cheap, which is it's main point. The staff we met were very friendly and helpful. The room itself was small, I'm talking about four or five feet clearance around a double bed, apart from a small nook that has hangars etc. Room was perfectly clean, had a fridge and an old (large) tv - free wireless internet in room, the bathroom was smallish but clean and everything was in working order. Noise-wise, not so good, we could hear what was going on in the rooms next to us pretty clearly although the people staying there were not being unduly noisy, just be aware that if you did have someone noisy next to you it might not be so good. Also two busy roads run within a block of the motel so if traffic noise is not your thing, stay somewhere else. I wear ear plugs when sleeping so it caused me no undue problems. The San Diego public works dept decided to chop some of the trees across the road and then chip the branches at 8.30 a.m. one morning which was also pretty noisy, obviously this is not something that the motel had any control over. Overall if you want to save on your accommadation and don't mind a bit of noise or being away from Downtown San Diego, this is worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nathan-rachel
Reviews.Content: This is a good value hotel, the rooms are nice and clean. There was complimentary breakfast but we didn't have time to stop and eat any. The staff were helpful and friendly and gave us a voucher for some restaurants 5 mins down the road. We went to a seafood restaurant, I can't remember the name but it was very nice indeed! There was pool, which we didnt use. Free parking and free internet. I like this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a long weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: FrmMAtoAZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true value. Rates were between $55-65 per night, while other hotels near by were twice as much or more. Now if you're used to luxury this isn't the place for you, but it is very clean and close by everything (airport, beach, zoo, cruises are all within a 10 minute drive). The rooms are small but cozy. It reminds me of the old motor inns by the shore along the East Coast, nothing too fancy but great for a weekend getaway . (I traveled with my mom and we shared a queen-sized room, which was plenty big enough). A continental breakfast in the morning consisted of muffins, juice, yogurt, coffee and fruit. The staff was super friendly and provided directions to anywhere we needed to go: the San Diego Zoo, shopping, local attractions, etc. A father and son team run the place and has been owned by the family for decades, even the housekeeper has been with the motel for 30+ years. The owner mentioned that most of his referrals come through TripAdvisor. I plan to return soon, as it was the perfect location for a weekend of exploration. (Note: Bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. There are no irons or alarm clocks in the rooms, and there are only showers - no tubs ... but cable TV, wifi, and mini fridges are provided.)

Reviews.Title: “very nice motel freindly staff”
Reviews.Author: cbradiorepair
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed two nights in april. every thing was clean. the people were very freindy and helpfull. the showers were hot and strong water. we will go back some time in the near future. the muffins and yogurt in the morning was terrific. it is across the street from the fishermans landing. that was cool seeing all the boats and stuff.the price was very affordable. we highly recomend this motel.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: AzJourney
Reviews.Content: The Blue Dolphin is an adorable little motel across the street from the harbor. The staff were friendly. The rooms were clean. It was a no frills room but perfect for sleeping. i dont spend much time my hotel room when i travel so this was perfect. The commom patio/breakfast area was clean. Breakfast was great. Muffins, Yogurt, juice, coffee. It was quiet. I would definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget motel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Moose707
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Dolphin Motel for 3 nights. Since it was winter, it was very cold and the one blanket on the bed wasn't sufficient, and we also needed more pillows, so we notified the front desk and an extra blanket and pillows were brought up. Going into the bathroom, I noticed a long black hair on the sink. The man at front desk said this was from the housekeeper and apologized. They were very nice, and when we asked if they had a computer to use the internet, they gave us the hotel's laptop which we could take up to our room. Breakfast was muffins, yoghurt, bananas, coffee and juice. The best part about this motel was the shower.....it had the best water pressure of the whole trip! Just like home. We would recommend this hotel if you want somewhere cheap to stay, that also includes breakfast and is close to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Dolphin Motel-Highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: dawnalo
Reviews.Content: My husband, 5 year old, & I stayed at the Dolphin Motel for 7 nights. The owners very helpful with dinner recommendations, directions, etc. Location was great-close to downtown, Point Loma, Old Town, Mission Beach, only 30 minutes to Carlsbad. The free breakfast each morning (coffee, yogurt, muffins) was a definite plus. My husband & I are frugal travelers and definitely felt like this hotel was an excellent value! We would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Two THUMBS UP! Great Break from the Boring Chain Hotels”
Reviews.Author: dlobmwm3
Reviews.Content: TWO THUMBS UP!!! If you are looking for a family run, friendly staff, great location, and GREAT owners, this place is for you. Where can you stay and actually get to talk to the owners on a daily basis? We stayed here for 6 nights to visit the San Diego Zoo, Legoland, Disneyland, local beaches, and local attractions. We actually didn't know who ran the chain until the 2nd morning of our stay because all the staff members are so helpful and friendly. They are always asking if everything was ok and if we needed to find somewhere to go for shopping, dining, or attractions to visit. Summary of how friendly the staff and owners were: 1) We left our shampoo at home and they allowed us to have some for free without charging us. 2) We also left our hair dryer at home and they supplied one for us. 3) No matter where we wanted to go, the staff and owners were always able to answer our questions or take the time to show us on a map or draw on a map. 4) The father and son (owners) always made us feel at home like it was a bed and breakfast at the beach!!! They were particular in entertaining our 4 year old son. 5) Breakfast is FREE - Daily bananas, muffins, and yogurt with coffee or orange juice. 6) Last and best, our flight back to North Carolina was not scheduled to depart until 10:50 PST, which is 1:50 AM EST. So we asked the owner (father) if we could check out later than 12 pm since our son naps still. They allowed us to check out at 3 pm vs. 12 pm so our son could get a nap FREE OF CHARGE!!!!!!. The only reason why I gave 1 less than the 5 stars for service was the house cleaning does just a little later than normal. And the only reason for the 1 less than the full 5 stars for sleep quality, was due to the one of the beds being harder than our home bed. But again, this is personal preference. We were not surprised by the room size as the pictures clearly show the size but it was just enough for the three of us. The rooms are always clean and kept up very well. All in all, we would stay here every time if we come back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A trip back in time”
Reviews.Author: Amador
Reviews.Content: The place was spotlessly clean and well maintained, and the owners/staff were friendly and helpful. However, our room above the office was tiny, and straight out of 1940. Not a thing had been updated except for the TV. We left after one night, in search of a roomier and more up-to-date room.

Reviews.Title: “This will be the place to stay next time I am in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Miranda77
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a vacation to San Diego and I decided to take a break from the big chain hotel and motels and took a chance with the Dolphin. I am glad I did. It was clean, the people that work there are friendly and helpful. The room was small, but that didn't bother me, the bathroom is old fashioned, but I loved it and all the character the building had. It kind of reminded me of what it was like sleeping at my Grandparents house....I felt safe, comfortable and relaxed. This will be the only place I stay when I visit San Diego in the future and I have been raving about the Dolphin to everyone who asks where I stayed. My only issue was the noise I heard in the other rooms, TV's and talking at 2am, but I easily solved it by turning on the a/c fan, problem solved. Also, I much appreciated the cleaning staff making my bed and replacing towels each night, I might suggest that they might visit a alittle earlier in the day, all 3 nights I stayed they came after 2pm, when I was hoping to stop back in my room for a rest before heading back out for the evening, I felt like I had to leave and come back so they could finish their work. I love the Dolphin Motel, can't wait to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service does exsists!”
Reviews.Author: dmtravler
Reviews.Content: Dolphin Motel is so awesome. I have to tell you that I almost stayed next door. -m so glad we came here instead. I was blown away with the staff and the owners of this Motel. They made me and my fiance feel as if we were the only ones there! The rooms are nice and very clean too. In the morning they offer muffins, coffee, orange juice, tea, yogart, banannas. I loved the bannanas and yogart with my muffins each morning. There was also a newspapeer available too. We really enjoyed our stay and felt genuinally welcomed. Can't wait to return this summer. -Doreen Mobley

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at The Dolphin Motel”
Reviews.Author: SteveKinSF
Reviews.Content: When I travel I try to stay at clean, family run hotels and this place fits the bill. It's nice to talk to the owners Alan & Holly over their continental breakfast every morning. Rooms were very clean as usual and the staff helpful and friendly. Love this place! Makes me feel at home...I'll be back. P.S. Don't much care for the big impersonal chains.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Relax!”
Reviews.Author: dobieluvrs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our anniversary and plan to do that each year. The motel is always clean and well maintained. It is small but really if you are in San Diego how much time is spent in the room anyway? The beds are always clean and well kept... and after speaking to the owner and his son during our stay we think this is by far the best place in San Diego hands down. There is a small breakfast offering (muffins and coffee) which we love to partake of as we stroll across the street to the harbor and watch the fishing boats loading up for their day at sea. Truly this place is AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel was average”
Reviews.Author: EnderJ
Reviews.Content: I got a cheap room for being broke. However the hotel staff could have been better. THe hotel was not fully clean, however it was clean enough. I disliked the food from the locals. However, the overall quality of this hotel was good. Overall i think you get what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly, very clean, great location!”
Reviews.Author: sarahpalin2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dolphin Motel for our first vacation ever with our 2 little ones (ages 2 & 5) and had a great time! I am a clean freak and the rooms were spotless! White everything, so you would be able to see if it were dirty, but it wasnt! The rooms were small, but it worked out great, the kids just did everything on their bed, played with toys, colored, read, watched cartoons. The bathroom was cute, I loved the old tile, it had charm:) The kids to this day ( 6 months later!) still talk about the nice man that brought them McDonalds apple pies EVERY single morning we were there! That nice older man was the OWNER! He was so sweet and just loved to see the kids in the morning! We live in the desert , so to sit outside with an ocean breeze, listening to seagulls while sipping coffee every morning was heaven! The houskeeping girl was so nice as well! We always go through a lot of towels and she was always right there to hand us more! And let me tell you how much nicer our vacation was because of the nice front desk man! He recommended so many fun things to do, and we did all of them! Our favorite was Coronado Beach and Sea World! And dont forget the great restaurant Pizza Nova right across the street! And walking by the water watching the fishing boats come in was fun for us AND the kids! Oh, it was such a beautiful, safe and clean part of town! To the father and son owners and the small personable staff, thank you for a GREAT first family vacation last year! Cant wait to come back and enjoy your beautiful city once again! THANK YOU SO MUCH! Bryan & Kim Greene Boulder City, Nevada

Reviews.Title: “A nice visit.”
Reviews.Author: rheo3000
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, white and looks exactly like picture. The room was small, as expected. My only complaint was how thin the walls are. My husband and I went to dinner and a movie. We got back to the room a little after 11 on Saturday. We turned on the tv and within 5 minutes the neighbor knocked on the door and told us that we would need be quiet. It was a little shocking as we were not making noise beyond the tv and a few comments between us about what time we'd be leaving in the morning. I would not recommend staying in the motel if you are planning to do anything at night. Overall a good stay. Close to everything to do in San Diego. A clean and safe base from which to explore San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFL
Reviews.Content: .....this was my fourth stay over the years....and this stay was once again, an excellent experience.....with the owners on site, its a great place to stay...let me list a few things. .....room and bath....SPOTLESS .....matress more comfortable than that I have in my home .....white everything....sheets, bed spread....and wonderful fluffy huge bath towels .....continental b'fast w/muffins, juice, yogurt, and GOOD coffee (a rare find on freebie hotel b'fasts) .....and before I forget.......THE PRICE WAS RIGHT!....particularly in 'pricey' San Diego! .....oh yes, the free HS internet was a welcome plus There is a good variety of restaurants nearby (and a new one a block away set to open this Spring) .....so I asked myself....."What's not to like?".....and my answer was...."The time came that I had to leave!" .....guess what?.....I'm already looking forward to my next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, great staff, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HughesYordadi
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week on a business trip. One of our company computers was unable to connect to the Dolphin's high-speed wireless internet (computer problem), so they moved us to a room closer to the router. Very accommodating staff, great breakfast items (lots of coffee!) in the mornings. HD televisions, close to airport and America's Cup Harbor. This is a great hotel in San Diego, and the price is amazing. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, excellent, excellent!”
Reviews.Author: pedalcrazy
Reviews.Content: This is the type of accommodation budget conscious travellers look for but rarely find, a combination of great location, sparkling clean rooms, reasonable rates and hosts that cannot do enough for their guests. Located across the street from Fisherman's Landing on the north side of San Diego Bay this 31 unit, two storey motel, is close to the airport, I-5 freeway, numerous attractions including Sea World, excellent Mexican restaurants and a take-out sea food eatery that is a favorite with locals and visitors alike. Upper level rooms have a view of the harbour. Rooms on the first floor open onto a spacious walled courtyard where guests enjoy free coffee and muffins in the morning. The facility offers free Wi-fi and a loaner lap-top computer for those guests who did not bring their own. My interest was in bicycling. The motel owners graciously provided convenient storage for my bike as well as suggestions and directions for bicycle tours. The area has numerous bike paths; trips of 10 to 20 miles can be safely and conveniently done starting from this location. I enjoyed the hospitality at the Dolphin Motel for a week in December 2009 and hope to visit there again in 2010. I recommend this gem of a motel for travellers interested in clean, safe, basic, and very hospitable accommodation in a convenient area of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Family owned and run, friendly service, small clean rooms in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: hahnecho
Reviews.Content: This is an old, family owned/run, motel that is very conveniently located and inexpensive. The owners, Murdocks, are actually there most of the time and offer friendly service. The rooms are small but clean with good wi-fi connections. Heater/ac units are a bit primitive but they work and, besides, who cares; this is San Diego. The office is very helpful in weighing your bags, printing out boarding passes, etc. A byproduct of such a place is that the guests are very friendly, too; the friendly atmosphere must rub off on all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Still the Best!!”
Reviews.Author: erniehammers
Reviews.Content: It was our second time staying at the Dolphin Motel in San Diego (Point Loma) and once again we were thoroughly impressed!! The rooms are spotless and the location is great!! It is just a 5 to 10 minute cab from SAN airport. I had our same room overlooking the pool which was very clean and quiet!! The owners father and son- Holly & Allen Murdock are the most gracious hosts!! They provide fresh muffins and hot coffee/juice in the courtyard each morning, where you can sit and read the paper under the sun umbrellas. They also are very helpful in helping you plan day trips in the San Diego area. Prices are great and the location is tops!!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly Staff, very clean, I Loved!!!”
Reviews.Author: blandejoli
Reviews.Content: I stay there for two weeks, I loved this place, Staff is so nice, they even let me borrow a celphone since I came from Brazil and did not have one, it`s less then a block away from the bus route. Excellent Location!!! Very Clean!!! Very Friendly Staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Motel For Fishermen”
Reviews.Author: PlanetYellowfin
Reviews.Content: Up until last year I lived in Chicago, and I came to San Diego for long-range fishing once per year. I stayed at the Dolphin because it was the cheapest motel near the landing, and because it was the closest motel to the landing. Both of these facts remain true... I moved to San Diego a year ago because I am an avid long-range fisherman. Every time I embark on a fishing trip, the day before the trip I stay at the Dolphin. First, I don't want a driving nightmare in the morning as I try to make it to the dock in time to plant my tackle box near the front of the line (get the best location for tackle on the boat). Second, I can leisurely stroll to and from the dock as boats come in, and check out the catch, say hello to other fishermen leaving on my trip (or similar trips) the next day, check out the local tackle shops--there are about a dozen of them, and they are some of the best-equipped in the world. The famous bar, Captain's Quarters--where all the fishermen and crew hang out, both before and after a trip--is about 150 feet away. Shelter Island is where the headliner musical groups show, and it is a fun moderate walk from the Dolphin, as is the second-best view of the downtown--out on Shelter Island.
